Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good value”
Reviews.Author: ianochaye
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice in recent months. The price was similar but the apartments were different in size and outlook. A colleague who was in a room facing 1st Avenue found it quite noisy, so ask if you are a light sleeper. The rooms I have had were perfectly adequate, decently furnished, and with a satisfactory kitchen. Bathrooms a bit small, but ok. I slept well and that's what matters. The staff were friendly and helpful and the location is well served with shops and restaurants nearby on 1st and 2nd and the cross streets. Ideal for the UN. There is a $ 12.95 charge for 24 hours wifi. I shall certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: jazzbass
Reviews.Content: I've probably spent 30 nights in the Beekman Towers Hotel over the last 30 years. Like a previous reviewer, I discovered the Beekman when Manhattan East (it's previous management group) leased the rooms to corporations and rented the temporarily vacated rooms on the weekends. The hotel has changed little over those decades. That's both good and bad: As other reviewers have pointed out, it's a little threadbare. The carpets, drapes, and furnishings are outdated and worn. That's honestly not a problem. The place is unfailingly clean. The views are great. The staff is supportive. The location is wonderful. The rooms are quiet. The place feels safe. The prices are good. It's no five star hotel, but it remains my favorite NYC refuge. Pay the few extra dollars for the better rooms rather than settling for the base-line efficiency suites.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Find”
Reviews.Author: Antidisestablishment
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four nights. The 1 BR suite was bigger than most Manhattan apartments and was very comfortably furnished. The furnishings were not new, but everything was perfectly functional and very clean. The room was very quiet and the mattress was excellent compared to most hotels. For the price you won't find anything that even comes close to this. We ate one night at the Tower restaurant and the food, service and view were all excellent. The surrounding neighborhood is very safe with lots of restaurants, pubs and grocery stores to choose from. Everything in Manhattan is easily accessible via foot, bus or subway, so the location of this hotel wasn't a drawback at all. In fact, it is right next to an FDR drive exit which made getting there, and back out of the city, a snap. The staff were all great too. We are looking forward to our next trip to NYC in part because we plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice View”
Reviews.Author: Samantha L
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights, great people, great view from the top. But we were on 4th floor, over looked a patio and was woken up by construction at 6:40am on a Sunday Morning. Kinda of wish it was closer to a subway station

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel/great staff”
Reviews.Author: patorourke
Reviews.Content: my wife daughter and i stayed <11/16 feb> lastweek it was our second visit to new york in 4 monts from ireland tom the outside it doesnt saymuch the interior is ok wehad a 6.th floor one bedroom suite it was spacious and clean and <maid keep it clean every day> the suite was comfortably warm the front desk people were friendly and polite especially jenny who got tickets to marypoppinsfor us passes to 9/11 printed for us the concirige is also very helpful we enjoyed dinner in the tower restaurant on our last night the diner across theroad is graeat for food as well we will stay again

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: mihaela p
Reviews.Content: This hotel has two valuable things: the location and the price. After 5 days spent in this hotel, I would advice everyone to go for more expensive places and have a nicer environment. Everything was terrible in the hotel, the insulation, the heating was not working, the bathroom was increddibly small, the cleanliess was far from the standards! The breakfast was not included in the price, and it was poor and expensive. If I would be again in NY, I will definitely choose another hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely good value, comfortable, great staff”
Reviews.Author: rredge
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at the Beekman 32 years ago, at a time when corporations had many of the apartments on long-term lease and rented them by the week when they weren't being used. For a 22 year old on his first trip to New York, this was a great deal, and what I liked about the Beekman at the time was that the apartment was spacious and comfortable - like staying in a home rather than a hotel room. I have stayed in the Beekman twice since then, most recently this past weekend, and I still have that feeling. Comfort is built into the place. The Beekman differs from most hotels is that it was constructed for people to live in rather than stay overnight. As architectural historian Chrisopher Gray says in his recent New York Times article about the Beekman, it was originally designed, back in the late 1920s, as apartments for young professional women: http://www.nytimes.com/2011/12/04/realestate/streetscapes-a-residence-for-educated-women.html The apartment that I stayed in this weekend reflects that. It was what they call a Superior Queen. I opened the door to an entryway, a kitchen large enough for proper cooking, a large living/dining area (15' x 18'), a bedroom (10' x 10') with a comfortable Queen Size bed, a bathroom with dressing area, and two clothes closets. The kitchen had plenty of counter and cupboard space, and older but quite decent GE appliances (fridge/freezer, gas stove with four burners and an oven, microwave and dishwasher, as well as a coffee maker and toaster). The living/dining area had a sofa for four with two side tables, a coffee table, two armchairs, a writing desk, and dining room table with four chairs. There were two televisions, one in the living room and one in the bedroom. There was also an iron and full size ironing board in one of the closets. I don't really care about safes, but there was one of those too. My accommodation was spotless and the housekeeping staff were efficient and courteous. The bed appeared to be fairly new. The furniture was older, and the carpets, while clean, really ought to be replaced. The televisions are out of date, but work fine. As the Beekman itself acknowledges, the furnishings could use some renovation. Unfortunately, the current owners purchased it at the height of the real estate market and the cost of renovations was underestimated. If you want the details, do a Google search on Beekman, Timothy Haskins (the promoter behind the purchase) and Allied Irish Bank (now taken over by the Irish Government). Given the comfort of the accommodation, the price that I paid, and the fact that the apartment was spotless, I had no problem with the fact that the television sets are old and some of the furniture and the carpets have seen better days. As for location, the Beekman is a block from the UN in one of New York's wealthier areas. Irving Berlin's townhouse, now the Luxembourg Mission to the UN, is about 1 1/2 blocks away. So is Katherine Hepburn's home at 244 East 49th St., which you can apparently rent for $25,000/month. But realize that this is not the city's most exciting neighbourhood. See it as a base from which to do some exploring. That said, there are some very good shops and restaurants in the area. That first trip to New York 32 years ago led to living in the city for some time, including recently, so here are a few examples just north of the Beekmanâ€¦ between 51st and 52nd Streets on 1st Ave, you will find Ideal Cheese and Pisacane Midtown. Ideal is widely regarded as one of New York's two best cheese shops, the other being Murray's in Greenwich Village. Pisacane is a superb fishmonger, in case you get a hankering to bring a couple dozen oysters back to the Beekman. And if you're into flowers, especially orchids, ZezÃ©, one of New York's better florists, is right beside Pisacane. This block is not unique. There are lots of good shops in the area; you just have to do a little hunting or tap some local knowledge. Finally, I should add that the front desk, bellman and housekeeping staff were a pleasure to deal with. Really nice people all around.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay including excellent dinner and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: AlSeppa
Reviews.Content: The suite where I and family members stayed in October 2011 showed its age, particularly in the carpeting and upholstery. However, the place was clean and very pleasant. The restaurant at the top floor was excellent. The meals and service were great! Altogether, a good value. Although a bit far from the nearest subway station, we would definitely stay there again. Al, Pittsfield, MA

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: sb_osobailiando
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed at the Beekman during a quick theatre weekend in NYC. It is not easy to find a reasonably priced triple room that is actually comfortable. It is also challenging to find hotels in NYC that will allow you to check in on Saturday for a two-night stay, and they were obliging. Our suite was a lot larger than most moderately priced NYC hotel rooms, and very clean. The only issue I had was with very small bathroom with almost no counter space, and the bottom of the tub was slick as glass; two of us almost slipped. We ate breakfast one morning at the hotel--not impressed, there are many better options in the area for food. If you don't mind a 7 to 8 block walk to the theatre district, this hotel offers good value for the money. Taxis are readily available since the hotel is right by the United Nations. Staff was very good, we arrived before noon and they let us check in our room. Whenever we called for extra towels, they were delivered almost immediately. There was a full kitchen, which we didn't need, but would be great for someone who needs extended stay facilities. I think the Beekman was at one time an "all single ladies" hotel, hence the rooms are more like apartments. Furnishings need updating--had big box TVs in living area and bedroom. Overall, very pleased with our stay and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Banjoman2007
Reviews.Content: The Beekman Tower Hotel is a moderately-priced (for NYC), somewhat shabby, hotel located on the East Side of Manhattan near the United Nations on the corner of First Avenue. My father reserved a suite and it was spacious - but not exactly of the quality one would expect from a "four star" (whatever that means) hotel. I slept on the pull-out sofa in the "living room" and had to walk through the bedrooom to get to the tiny bathroom. Not a comfortable sleep on the thin mattress so beware of you use that option. There was a little kitchen and the faucet on the kitchen sink leaked water all over the floor. The top-floor restaurant was empty at 8:30 AM which made me wonder whether the hotel was fully-occupied on a Friday night. Staff seemed very nice but we really did not avail ourselves of any services other than breakfast Saturday morning in the empty dining room. I would want to see other rooms before I decided to stay at the Beekman again as there may be newer hotels at the same price.

Reviews.Title: “More like Fawlty Towers”
Reviews.Author: cynthiarmstrong
Reviews.Content: Well, the best things i can say about this hotel were that the suite was roomy and the location was good. Other than that, the room and furnishings were old and the mattress and mattress pad had a huge, suspicious yellow stain on it. They did replace the mattress, but it kind of gave us a queasy feeling about the room in general. There was a basic kitchenette, which should have had a microwave, but did not. Would I stay there again? Well, maybe if it was really a cheap deal. On a positive note, they have a restaurant/bar on the 26th floor that has really breathtaking 360 degree views of NYC & the East River. It has a beautiful Art Deco decor. I don't know how the food is because we only had drinks, but our server was very, very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: mspiteri1
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Beekman Hotel 19th and 20th December and had the most wonderful stay. It was our first time visiting New York. The hotel was lovely, felt very 'boutique', the rooms were very good size and very clean and ideal for our two day stay. The hotel was situated on the east of Manhatten over looking Roosevelt Island and took us about 15 minutes to walk into central broadway area. We pretty much walked everywhere. The restaurant on the top floor was sooo romantic, a must! and the food was very good too. Not a 5 star hotel, but absolutely perfect/ ideal for a couple on a budget, weekend break. The staff where also very nice and helpful. Thanks Beekman Hotel, will definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but interior needs work”
Reviews.Author: Helena P
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on relatively short notice for Christmas in NYC at a very good price. The location is perfect, close enough to walk everywhere we wanted to go but far enough from the noise and tourists. The room was clean but it was very ugly - old carpets, a sleeper sofa that needed reupholstering instead of a tacky slipcover, poor lighting, and the heat was noisy. The kitchen was surprisingly large, and the bathroom was old-style NY. It felt more like we were at an apartment than a hotel. There was even a trash compactor room in the hallway which reminded me of "The Odd Couple". The fitness center was excellent, and it had the same equipment I use at my gym. It was clean and open 24 hours/day. I was also surprised to see 3 elevators so there was never a long wait. We didn't have a "view" per se but it was a classic NYC view - the river, people's apartments, even a water tower. I never got tired of looking out the windows.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, quiet but convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: jewelsaj
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel because of the charm of an old, Art Deco building with large rooms, and we have found ourselves a new home away from home when in NYC. The geographic area is safe and quiet (a very nice switch from the Times Square area!); the staff are very courteous and professional; and our room was huge! Since there were 3 adults, we were assigned a king deluxe room and we walked into a clean, well-appointed and very large living area with high ceilings, dining room and living room where the sofa was already made into a bed. There was a "power room", small kitchen, and then into a master suite with king bed and full bath. Adding to the charm of the place is the lovely rooftop Top of the Tower restaurant which truly does have wonderful views. It is disappointing that the owners of this historic gem have not done more to keep it up. The rooms are very spacious and nice, but the carpet has ripples from too many cleanings, wallpaper is peeling, and the upholstered furniture has rips in the fabric. I hope the hotel will be restored to it's former glory, updated to reflect it's history while making the guest feel they have been transported back in time to the bygone era of the 1930s when the Rockefeller's and Astor's made New York grand.

Reviews.Title: “Charming home away from home...”
Reviews.Author: Mysteriouskat
Reviews.Content: The Beekman is nestled in a very nice, quiet neighborhood that is only a few blocks away from the United Nations. Not surprisingly, many ambassadors and other dignitaries stay here. The added convenience is that each suite has a mini-kitchenette (with a stove-top, microwave, sink & fridge), a spacious living room to receive guests and a separate bedroom. Just in case for some reason you are suffering from a rare condition and donâ€™t have anything to do in New York, there are television sets in each room. Although the lobby is fairly small (standard for New York), the suite is particularly large. The dÃ©cor is gorgeous Art Deco, which provides plenty of old-fashioned charm to this hotel. Lately it has become increasingly difficult to find a hotel that doesnâ€™t look like every other hotelâ€”and this one certainly doesnâ€™t look like any other hotel. The staff is extremely helpful, going above and beyond duty. There are no attitudes, merely a laid-back, helpful vibe. There are no disturbances, no noise, in this NY oasis. Although the hotel isnâ€™t modern and new, everything on my last visit has been in perfect working condition and clean. Coming back to the Beekman each night was like coming back home, but cozier. It felt like a luxurious private apartment more than a hotel. If I could, Iâ€™d move in permanently. (Who knows, maybe one day theyâ€™ll put out an ad for a writer-in-residence) Of special note is the Top of the Tower restaurant, which was named as one of the most romantic places in New York. Itâ€™s easy to see why. Although Iâ€™m not particularly impressed be the food, this is quite the spot for late night drinks â€“ which are delicious. The views of the harbor and city are absolutely mesmerizing. In fact, it all feels rather magical. Like a scene from some enchanting movie, enhanced by flickering candles, the classy-yet-so-down-to-earth service, and the score, provided by some wonder pianist, who is the soul of this picture. Unfortunately, though, they no longer employ a pianist, which I think diminished the atmosphere. (Please note, I have stayed in this particular hotel about 7-8 years ago, so things might have changed since then. I have visited the restaurant more recently).

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful place for our first trip..... highly recommended!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: leehill1
Reviews.Content: having booked new york for our first time to the states we were a bit worried about the reviews we read. How wrong we were!! The staff were amazing, we were allowed to drop suitcases off early, they always wanted to help and give advice when needed, nothing was too much trouble. The room was on 19th floor and was exactlywhat we needed for our stay clean, comfortable and easy to stay in (why people moan about a room when in new york is beyond me). The hotel was close to all locations, 20 mins to top of the rock, grand central, times square etc. Overall a fantastic venue and location and wouldnt hesitate to use them again..... in fact looking at booking them again for next year.......Thankyou for your hospitality. Debbie and Lee Hill 19a1, Gloucester, England!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor! poor! poor!”
Reviews.Author: Jas G
Reviews.Content: I like to think of myself as low maintenance, but this is clearly the worst hotel I've stayed in since 1995 when I was a student and paid $50 for the union square hotel in san francisco. They don't even have a hair dryer on the room, and the chair fell apart when I touched it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and a nice location”
Reviews.Author: Moose797
Reviews.Content: We just left the beekman tower hotel and had a great time. I wasn't sure how we would find the hotels based on some reviews but everything was great. The room was clean and in great shape. There were some dings and scratches on the furniture but it's an older hotel. The beds were great the bathroom and room clean. It was great to have the windows open to too. We were on the 22nd floor and had a balcony. All these are very unusual fro NYC hotel. The restaurant on top of the hotel had great views and was great for breakfast. And it's in a nice neighboorhood. All in all i was very happy with the stay and a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Rosemary K
Reviews.Content: Had a recent stay with three girlfriends for sightseeing and shopping, in a 2 bedroom apartment. Amazing views, the room decor was a bit tired and could do with an update but the apartment was large, clean and very comfortable which compensated for everything. The staff were always ready to help, so nice to be greeted every time we returned to the hotel. Had drinks and dinner in the restaurant which was a highlight. Was a great base as not far from the subway and an easy 20 minute walk to the Rockerfeller center, felt very safe walking back to the hotel at night. Will recommend to friends who want a serviced apartment in a good position in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great Art Decco venue”
Reviews.Author: Ullysees
Reviews.Content: Beekman Tower on corner of First and forty ninth is a great base for discovering new York. Each suite has a kithchenette that includes an oven and gas top and coffee maker. Our suit on 18th floor had a large dining/lounge area with period furniture including a dining room table. When snowed in unexpectedly this space was welcome. Easy walking to Times Square or the bus past the Parkside museums. Good buses down or uptown run on first and second Avenue and cross town to Chelsea wharves on 42nd St. Only Quibble loud air conditioner/heater.

Reviews.Title: “In real need of refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: Chesca11
Reviews.Content: First the positives: staff were excellent - very friendly and professional. And the location was good. But, unfortunately there were quite a few negatives... The room was very outdated. Furniture was 'tired'; at least half the lights didn't work or flickered annoyingly; the bathroom was very basic; and worse of all the room was cold. The heater in the living room worked (though was very noisy) but the one in the bedroom didn't. And I'm afraid the single blanket on the bed just wasn't enough for New York in November. A shame, because as I say the staff were lovely, but I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Well....”
Reviews.Author: shelbye1220
Reviews.Content: So a couple weeks ago, my marching band was in New York to be in the Veteran's Day Parade and we stayed at the Beekman. I can understand that having 87 teenagers and 20 or so of their parents would be stressful on a hotel, but upon our arrival, our rooms weren't even ready and some rooms didn't have blankets on the beds or towels in the bathroom. The room I was in, 3E to be exact, was less than perfect. The mattress was VERY hard and uncomfortable, our heater unit was literally falling off the wall, as was the smoke detector. The bathroom was FILLED with mold hand had no ventilation system. And our refrigerator made extremely loud noises that made feeling somewhat comfortable in the room, difficult. The elevators never seemed to be quite right, and one of our rooms had not one, but two cockroaches. We also had some sort of breakfast service that was less than perfect, some mini pastries, fruit (the high point), yogurt which was never quite cold, cereal, and a variety of milk and juices... something warm would have been nice. Now on the plus side, the staff was very welcoming, our maid was very personable and had a good sense of humor. They were also very open to a group of our size, which some hotels aren't. All in all, it was a place that I would not have chosen, but it worked out OK. PS: Any pictures that you see online of the Beekman, not quite what you're getting.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: jennifer y
Reviews.Content: this is a great place to stay. Nice size room with your own bathroom (which is great for NYC). It's within a half mile of times square and very safe to walk at night. For the price you can't beat it. Everyone is super nice and willing to help especially with directions and help getting around. Some reviewers have put things about the carpet not being new and small bathroom...i had bedroom shoes as i do in EVERY hotel i stay in so it didn't bother me at all and the bathroom was fine, you have great water pressure and super clean so i couldnt ask for more. When you go to NY you really aren't in your room long at all (sleep and shower). The Beekman is also located in a very quiet neighborhood so you can actually sleep at night which is also a plus. If you are undecided about where to stay this is where i recommend!

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: cari b
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the Beekmam hotel and will start with the pros ideal location, great little diner over the road for a good breakfast, friendly staff everything we needed in the room including equipped kitchen, clean sheets and towels fab view off the area and we liked the quaintness of the 50s style of the lobby and elevator music, but and its a big but if you want beautifully decorated rooms finished to a good spec and you are piccy when it comes to finishing details under no circumstance book this hotel diy and general up keep are not a priority but we have had a great week in manhatten

Reviews.Title: “i do not recommend this hotel. old dated and not clean”
Reviews.Author: Sam F
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my family and didn't enjoy it at all. The price was extremely expensive for such a hotel; apparently it's a high season in Manhattan at this time of year and all the hotels were expensive. Hotwire picked up this hotel for us, it was about $260USD a night. The staff were professional and helpful, but the room was a disaster! Starting with the carpet...old and disgusting looking; the kitchenette was out dated, and the beds were uncomfortable and very noisy. The AC/Heater were old and very very noisy; we used to leave it on when we go out and as soon as we enter we turned it off. Found small Cockroaches in the bathroom and near the bed! The hotel was not close to the metro station, you need to walk for 15 minutes to get into the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, updated, great location!”
Reviews.Author: leeislovinlife
Reviews.Content: Location location location! We stayed in a suite with a kitchen and pullout couch. Huge room at a good value for NYC! Store across the street, neighborhood was attractive and nice. Convenient walking distance to lots of attractions! Very pleased!

Reviews.Title: “quite unique”
Reviews.Author: curiousScandinavia
Reviews.Content: we chose Beekman Tower Hotel for its uniqueness, because we wanted something different from the usual anonymous hotels.Unique it is, but it also has a strong touch of "yesterday" not necessarily in a positive way.Our rooms were dark and smelled dusty, the furniture and carpets were worn,curtains dirty.The view from the living room and bedroom was very restricted which added to the claustrophobic feeling ( 4th floor). On the positive side: staff was friendly and helpful, plenty of umbrellas on a rainy day, problems w. heating were fixed quickly. didn't try restaurant, but had drinks in sky bar, good service, fantastic view

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned but great”
Reviews.Author: susiemay
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a one bedroom suite for one night with a friend and we had a great time. The room could use some touch ups for sure, especially the bathroom. But where in NYC can you stay for such a good price with a living room, dining room, and kitchenette! I imagine it would be fantastic for multiple night stays, to make use of the fridge etc and save some money on dining out. The staff are fantastic, everyone was friendly and helpful throughout our stay. Valet parking was decent, 24 hour period was $50. Don't expect brand new accommodations, be happy for the price you get, and enjoy your stay with friendly people.

Reviews.Title: “Rustic to say the least”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie0917
Reviews.Content: I stayed this past weekend with friends and family. The hotel is old and historic and has so much character and charm, but wow do the rooms need some updating to say the least. Our rooms was mismatched with furnishings dating from the 1930's and up. The curtains we truly filthy. There were phone cords and electrical cords just piled under the table in the living room. The kitchen had a gas stove in the kitchen - is that safe? The bathroom had hairs everywhere and lots of mildew around the tub - it didn't drain well either. You know the funny think is that it is NYC and I was with some of my favorite people so we had a great time. Would I stay again, maybe, but please I run an inn and I understand budgets and our economic times, but please consider updating and fast. I would hate to see such a great gem just go by the wayside. The do have to say the staff was very friendly - John offered to take our bags and gave us a great map and suggestions - He made the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding party”
Reviews.Author: sroth1955
Reviews.Content: We booked approx. a dozen rooms at the Beekman for family & friends attending a wedding. I was very pleased with this hotel's location and the room size, but most of all the helpful staff and excellent service we received. Without exception, they did everything possible to assist us (for many it was a first trip to NYC). They took extra care to help make our special event run smoothly and treated all of us as more than just hotel guests. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone coming to NYC and especially for a group.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Australians Abroad..Fab Location..Art Deco”
Reviews.Author: AussieLivingAbroad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights from Oct 7th arriving after midnight.The guy on the desk was friendly and welcoming and efficient in answering our questions. The hotel is in a safe neighborhood and we walked from Grand Central Terminal(about midnight) feeling comfortable with the surrounding streets and area in general. The hotel is close to some pretty funky pubs and diners and grocery stores. We found a fantastic Chinese restaurant 3 min walk from the hotel called Mee Noodle Shop at 2nd Ave and 49 th St..Cheap delicious food, efficient staff and always packed with people. The hotel has huge rooms and it was great to have a kitchenette.These kitchenettes are available in every hotel room (a rarity in NYC I'd say). We didn't like the first room we were placed in as it only had a double bed (not queen as expected) but the manager was able to move us for our last two nights which was perfect for us. The furniture in the room is certainly not modern but art deco as is the hotel in general . The bed and pillows were divine .Probably the most comfy bed I've slept in whilst traveling. The staff on the desk were always courteous and friendly and accommodating esp with our request to move rooms. We were able to jump on the Gray Line Hop on Hop off bus with our 2 day passes at the United Nations Headquarters stop so this was a bonus as well. We did walk into Times Square every day and it was a 20 min walk (much faster than a cab) so the location for us was perfect. This hotel is really quiet at night hence we slept so well. The windows are well insulated. The rooms were cool and the aircon perfect as we needed it a couple of days as the temp was 28 degrees celsius (82 fahrenheit ). This phenomenon known as an "Indian summer". Visited the 911 memorial site on our last day with our pre booked tickets and it really was remarkable how they have monumentalised this whole event and site. Well worth the visit but it did made me feel very sad just being there. Thanks New York City for putting on the superb weather for us. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay here again, worst experience”
Reviews.Author: Vinee S
Reviews.Content: When I booked this room over two months ago I requested to stay on a higher non smoking floor. After we checked in just before midnight (as our train had been delayed; and we were exhausted) we were put in a smoking room on a smoking floor. My family and I are all allergic to smoke, we tried to just put it past us but after about an hour we could barely breathe and my sister could not stop sneezing. Just before we went to bed, we checked the sheets and found two brown bugs in the sheets!!! We called the front desk told her exactly what happened. She argued back and told us they could not be bed bugs and told us we were probably seeing things and pretty much called us liars to our faces. She kept telling us there is no other rooms (ya right, people checked in after us and got rooms), and honestly at this point we were ready to pack up our stuff and leave; even though our room was pre-paid. After MANY MANY attempts to beg and ask for another room she finally put us on the east tower into a smaller room with only one bed for four people? As you can imagine it was so so uncomfortable; but we could just not stay in a room with bugs. The lady at the front promised to upgrade our room to the highest floor and a nicer room. With this promise we stuck it out through the night. Well the Next day our upgrade was to a lower floor and a filthier older room. When we went downstairs to talk to the manager he/she was always on a break or never available. When I finally did get a chance to talk to her she was super rude and just told me that we kept changing rooms and when I tried to explain that we can not sleep in a smoking room due to allergies her response was " we do not ever ask guests whether they want a smoking or non-smoking room, it is not our responsibility" When i told her about the bed bugs her response was " you cant assume they are bed bugs u can't see them with a human eye!" Well excuse me I am a nurse I have had a course on bed bugs, I have had training and I know how to check. Never in my entire life have I ever been treated this way by hotel staff, the worst part is she did not even appologize, or even sound like she cares. If you stay here dont expect much except for rude staff who don't care about your stay or your experience in their hotel. Honestly my opinion is that if you pre-pay for a room, you get treated like crap, why should they care you have already paid? And if that is not true Beekman Hotel you should really put your staff through a customer service training or hire some new employees who dont hate their job. This the impression of this hotel I am left with, and would not recommend anyone to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, clean, great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Effie_11
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Beekman for a week. Took the tip from other travelers and asked for a room on a high floor. We stayed with two teenage daughters in a one berdroom suite whcih was HUGE, esp. compared to NY hotel rooms. Kitchen was great for breakfasts/coffee.This is not a 5 star hotel, but the carpets were fine and the room was very clean. Great value for families. Minuses- Sofabeds are never really good for sleeping adults - there is enough space in the living room to put real beds. the fitness room is adequate but both TVs were gone when we were there. Would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Beekman Tower.”
Reviews.Author: froglegs55
Reviews.Content: Just got back from spending 4 nights there. We liked the history and character of this hotel. The staff (ALL of them) were most excellent. I asked for blankets...got them right away. I asked for a car to the airport...got it right away. Front desk folks are really nice. It's great to have a little kitchen. The rooms are big by NYC standards...ours was nice and quiet. Maids did a good job each day (it's nice to have the dishes washed and kitchen cleaned etc.) The curtains were not old or dirty...nothing was dirty. The sofa bed had a decent slipcover on it. Nothing about the room bothered me...what are others complaining about? If you have no washcloths or dish towels in your room just CALL downstairs and they'll bring whatever you need!! Had drinks at the bar/restaurant on the 26th floor. The best views ever up there! Our room did not have a good view but- hey..not every single room in any building can have a nice view. How much time do you spend in your room anyways? This hotel is a good price and I suspect when they remodel the prices will go up ALOT! Thanks for a wonderful vacation Beekman.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Christina C
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel and we had a fabulous time. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The rooms were large and was perfect for us, we were traveling with another couple. The full kitchen was handy and the location was great. I was a little concerned with seeing the negative reviews for this hotel, but I can say that although the furniture is a little worn, I appreciated the history, and the space of the suites can't be beat. Also the assistance in getting us to the airport (in a limo) and holding our luggage made our last day! I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “OK if you get a very good deal!”
Reviews.Author: amy b
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Beekman Tower Hotel in September for 5 nights and it was ok - good location, walking distance (15-20 mins) to time square and we got a good deal on priceline ($140/night). Upon check in we were placed in a suite with to twin bed - reservation was for one queen bed. Staff was friendly and switched us to another suite with a queen bed. The room seemed satisfactory at first. Clean bed, bathroom and kitchen but very old decor, carpet, curtains, etc. Carpet should be replaced asap!!! Stayed in the room for one night and started noticing small ants in the bathroom (more than 10 at a time) then later in the day found the same ones in the kitchen. After coming back to the hotel at midnight we decided we were not comfortable since these ants were probably also in the carpets! We called the front desk and were switched again to another even bigger room (bigger is definitely not better - I would rather a small clean and new room!). The final room ended up being fine, same old decor but it seemed clean and we felt more comfortable for the remainder of our stay. However, I would not stay here again and would not recommend it to anyone unless you can get an extremely good rate. Definitely not worth the rates posted on their website. I know reviews are mixed and it really depends on the room. If we stayed in the last room for the entire stay I would pobably have a different opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel...Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MrsMatt65
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early October 2011. I loved that we had a suite as there were 4 of us (2 adults and 2 kids), it was affordable and the rooms are large. My daughter and I took the hide a bed in the living room area ad it was surprisingly comfortable. Love that there was a kitchen and dining area, we were able to get water and fruit at the little store right across the street. While it is an older hotel and really is in need of some updating, the location is great. The M50 bus comes right across the street and takes you straight to Rockefeller Center or Times Square...or you can even walk. I would stay there again for sure!! We didn't have a lot of interaction with the staff, but when we did need information they were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Older Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrieger
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an older hotel that could use some updates. It was clean, but some normal maintenance items needed to be done, such has clean out light shades. Rooms were huge. We booked a room with a Queen bed. When we got there it wasn't a queen(it was listed in the computer as a Queen). They showed us another room so we could check bed size and it was great. Moved us with no problem. The staff was amazing!! Very friendly and helpful. All rooms have kitchens which is a great feature. There were no wash clothes or dish clothes. The wireless internet wasn't full signal. All that said, I would go back, just bring my own wash clothes and dish clothes/towels

Reviews.Title: “Beekman Towers - ok”
Reviews.Author: THR298
Reviews.Content: The staff was rude, the carpets in the room dirty and the sofa stained and extremely worn out. Also there was a thick layer of dust/grease on the window blinds plus receipts from previous guests under our bed linens... Not nice. Still get an "Average" - mostly for the pretty cool 30's style in the corridor to te elevator. Also the location is nice, and the restaurant on the 28th actually does have a nice view and friendly service (but on the other hand - you don't have to live at the hotel to go there). Overall - ok, but only if you get a good price...

Reviews.Title: “Close to United Nations”
Reviews.Author: buddabella
Reviews.Content: If you like sight seeing, such as the international feel of the UN, this the place to be. You can see not only the UN but it's a fun walk down the side streets to see all the countries' consulates places. It's a well kept entrance and foyer. Our room happened to have a problem with a non locking door, which is a big problem for any traveler. We were upgraded once it was known that we were not staying in that room. They also were very kind to accept my credit card over the phone to have my schoolbook shipped back to me immediately. It has been listed in the Bedbug registry lately, so I hope that it gets taken care of soon. I hope that wasn't a false report.

Reviews.Title: “Old and poor service but the price for the size of the room was decent.”
Reviews.Author: msanniota
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed when we walked into the hallway and then to our room. Although the room was very spacious - actually it was an extremely large suite with a family room, dining room, kitchen, desk area, 1 and 1/2 baths, large master bedroom...and the price for being this large a hotel room in Manhattan was very affordable...but the website of how the hotel looks on the inside was deceiving. The carpet was probably older than us, it looked like it was not renovated for a very long time. It was just very old and worn. The staff wasn't as friendly or accomodating as what we're used to when we go to hotels...so that was somewhat disappointing. It wasn't terrible - just be prepared that the hotel is very old but the room size for the suites were huge and the price we got was very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, good location, value for money, friendly.”
Reviews.Author: caramsc
Reviews.Content: I found the Beekman to be a charming hotel with its art deco style. The furniture fits in with this theme so don't expect modern furniture. The rooms are massive with a kitchen and eating area and plenty of room to sit and relax after long days of exploring New York. The room was clean and the bathroom and towels were spotless and staying here in February when it was still very cold, the room was always lovely and warm. The only minor point I can find with the room was that the sofa bed was a little worn, but this was not an issue as it was still comfortable and no sleep was lost. The staff were very friendly especially the bellman Ayman who always went out of his way to greet us with a smile and warm conversation (thanks Ayman this really did add to our stay). I really enjoyed staying here on my first trip to New York and will stay here again on my next trip whenever that might be. I would definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends. Great hotel, great staff, great location with good value for money. Thank you all at the Beekman for making my first stay in New York a good one. If you plan on staying here make sure you check out the nations cafe across the road which has good food and service and is good value for money. Also make use of the big Apple greeters to show you around you will need to book this in advance before you arrive on their website, this is a free service with fantastic volunteers, the best way to see the city with a New Yorker.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but I think I'd try something else.”
Reviews.Author: Barb1058
Reviews.Content: The decor was very old; ripped carpet and very dirty, bent mini blinds...and the room was very small. When I asked about changing rooms I was told something about it being an art deco hotel and all the decor in all rooms was that way. I wasn't sure if they meant torn carpet everywhere but....Anyway, the location is good and the staff otherwise were friendly. Hotels are expensive in the city but I am sure we still could have done better than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Turn back the clock to a kinder NYC”
Reviews.Author: chief791
Reviews.Content: I just spent the weekend with my wife at the Beekman Tower Hotel. We both loved it here. The building is a registered historic site. It is a great Art Deco style building from the 1920's. The Lobby and elevators are so nostalgic. It realy gives you the feeling of going back to the roaring 20's. The whole staff was great. Extra thanks to our Bellman Ayman and Henry. They were two of the best staff members we have ever met. Thanks again guys. The room was huge. We go to NYC alot and we have never gotten a room this big for the price we payed. There was a living room, full kitchen and bedroom. When i say FULL KITCHEN i mean it. Stove, sink refridge/freezer, micro wave,coffee pot and toaster. The bed was only a full size and the shower was kinda small but it was a small negative compared to the overall room. Yes the carpet was worn and the furniture dated. This was not a big deal for us. The Bar on the 26th floor was fantastic. Unbelievable view of the East river and you can see down 1st ave for about 30 blocks. We came back here after dinner in Hells Kitchen. You can sit outside or inside. The tables inside were very romantic with Lil candles and swing music playing. Overall we loved it here. It is in a very safe area of the city. The U.N. was a block away. We loved the quite neighborhood after a day in the busy parts of the city. So step back in time and enjoy this wonderful Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Classy Historic Hotel, with large affordable suites!”
Reviews.Author: maxbialy
Reviews.Content: I was visiting New York on a business conference and booked, through Priceline, a small suite at this classy and historic hotel in the Turtle Bay neighborhood of New York's East Side. It's a few blocks from the UN and also, for history lovers, a block from composer Irving Berlin's townhouse, Katherine Hepburn and Stephen Sondheim's townhouse and even Auntie Mame's luxury apartment. My suite had a fully equipped kitchen and full bath. Excellent service, friendly staff who solved a problem at check-out and a fabulous bar, Top of the Tower, offering a spectacular view of the city and the Queens-borough Bridge made famous in Woody Allen's Manhattan. Loved my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: beached2131
Reviews.Content: The hotel reminded me of the "Roaring Twenties," the decor, music in the lobby (surprisingly small) and the elevator music. The rooms were clean, furniture was old and could use some replacing. I must say the staff went out of there way to help you, very friendly and would return because of them.

Reviews.Title: “dated but good location”
Reviews.Author: kbatastini
Reviews.Content: This hotel fit the bill for what we needed-- a last minute hotel in NYC for 1 night. Som pros are the locations--East side and walkable to lots of things--price & bar on the top of the hotel. Drinks were definately pricey, but the view is great and the perfect place to get a drink before heading back to our room. The room itself was mediocare & very dated. The tv was old, which I can deal with, but very limited cable access (you couldn't even get channels like ESPN). It suited our needs for one night, but I doubt I will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great sized room in a superb loaction”
Reviews.Author: masons73
Reviews.Content: As 5 of us were travelling we booked a two room suite which are quite rare in New York. A couple of weeks before travel we were advised that this room was no longer available a t this time. Instead we were offered a one bed suite and a studio suite in adjoining rooms which turned out to be fine. Reading the reviews we were concerned by some of the comments on the quality of the hotel. Whiilst the carpet was a bit threadbare and the sofa bed was a bit tatty, this was more than compensated for by the size of the accomodation and the high standard of cleanliness. The beds were super comfy and the kitchen was a real bonus. Also we travelled during a heatwave and were impressed that the AC performed realy well. In terms of location, we found it to be a very quite and safe part of the city. The closest subway was about 10 minutes walk away but we used the M50 bus which stops just on the other side of 1st Aveneue . This provides a frequent service cross town to 5th Avenue and Time Square/Broadway. Also there are plenty of good restaurants and bars in the local area. We were also impressed with the friendliness of the staff. If you are staying for any length of time use the weekly internet rate. All in all a great first stay in New York and we would certainly recommend friends to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Super Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Brisa03
Reviews.Content: Stayed just 1 night on a trip to see the Yankees play. Each staff person was unfailingly friendly and polite. The room was very, very clean. If you are looking for fancy with bells and whistles, this is not for you. If you want clean and friendly and a close location to the UN, look no further.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay! and we will be staying there again!!!”
Reviews.Author: RC_Gubala
Reviews.Content: The Beekman Hotel is a very nice hotel. it is dated that but it still give the charm of the art deco style. the staff are very will to help with your needs. when we checked in we noticed we didnt have any sheets for the pull out sofa. but with a quick phone call to the front desk, and we were set. it is a little bit of a walk to time square but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Won't return”
Reviews.Author: gardentraveler48
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms: one "upgraded" to a suite and the other not. The "upgrade" had no air conditioning in one of the suite rooms for two of the four nights we were there. Repeated phone calls were required before we could get a response. The wrong size sheets were used on one of the beds ie twin on a queen-size bed so the bed came unmade during the night. Pest traps for roaches were left on a nightstand. Towels in complete sets were never delivered even with daily phone calls. The "queensize" sofa beds are barely fullsize. We measured this and checked several online sites. This was not a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the price”
Reviews.Author: MzCrus
Reviews.Content: My first time in MYC and got a great price for a 3star (or was it 3.5star) hotel in NYC. THe area was FANTASTIC. It was very quiet and I felt safe. I got a great deal on priceline (less than $130/night). My daughter lost her lap top computer somewhere between DC and the Hotel. The staff was very helpful but alas we did not find it. The only complaint I had was the carpet and couch were a bit scarey. Also the ceiling in bathroom was in BAD repair. I am sure if I had complained they would have fixed it. It was minor to me so I didn't bother. The kitchen was nice to have. We requested a fry pan. It would be nice if they had spatulas. No worries, we justed used chop sticks and improvised. The hotel was nice. The AC worked great. I would recommend this hotel to any of my friends who don't want to pay a lot for a decent room in a great area. Oh yes, stay away from the store across the street. Go down the street to 3rd or 2nd and find a decent store to shop. The store prices are high and the food looked very stale.

Reviews.Title: “Poor quality of service”
Reviews.Author: javmarketing
Reviews.Content: Stayed there one week , first time . Room was fine for the price but front desk was poor , very poor. Rservation states internet acces included in rate but they charged me 12 dollars per day. Grantes late check out until 3 pm, that was nice but at 1.30 they sadi wilol charge us one day rate. Had to lÃ±eave hotel in a rush . Non cooperative in general.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room with a great price”
Reviews.Author: bcckphillips
Reviews.Content: We booked a room through hotels.com for a superior suite and were upgraded upon arrival to a balcony room. The balcony was under renovations but we still had a nice view. The room does show signs of wear but other than one bathroom not being cleaned (which was rectified immediately). The front desk staff was very helpful with suggestions and recommendations. It is a quiet area located by the UN. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stuck in the East Tower”
Reviews.Author: CapeCodKate
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a Hotwire reservation. (I wonder if substandard rooms are given to Hotwire, etc. customers?) I arrived early for my reservation and the front desk women were very friendly and nice. I was able to get into my room which was a huge plus. But the room was not. It was in the East Tower admittance to which was by two pass-coded doors. There were only two rooms per floor reached by a small elevator - creepy. The good: very large room with a comfortable bed and a kitchen. Front desk people were terrific. The bad: huge scaffolding unit outside my room so I couldn't open the curtains unless I wanted people peering in at me. There was a portable AC unit which was making a weird sound. (I was told they were repairing the room unit.) I thought it would be all right. It wasn't. I almost asked to be switched at 9:30 at night because of the noise from the unit. No internet - they said they charge for third party guests like Hotwire. The front desk woman gave it to me for free which was nice, but it still didn't work. There was no swinging auxiliary lock like (I thought) is standard on all hotel rooms. Old and not-so-clean tub/shower. This hotel was rated 3 stars on Hotwire. It should have been 1 or 2. I stayed at the Helmsley the next week on another Hotwire reservation and that was 3 1/2 stars. No comparison - that was pure luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Far exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: bigAlandR
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Travelocity as a "Top Secret Hotel," which means I didn't know what hotel I had booked until I had made my nonrefundable reservation. Once I learned I had booked five nights at the Beekman Tower Hotel I read some of the reviews here on Trip Advisor. The reviews were, at best, mixed. My partner and I have just gotten home from our five nights at the Beekman Tower Hotel and we could not have been more pleased with the entire experience. When we checked in, we found that the air conditioner in our room did not work. I informed the front desk, which immedieately sent up a maintanence person. He determined the air conditioner could not be quickly repaired, so we were given an identical room on a different floor. The room was very comfortable. It had a queen sized bed which was very comfortable. The fabric on the sofa was a bit worn, but the sofa and other furntiture was very comfortable. Our room had a full kitchen which included a refrigerator, microwave, and range. There was cutlery, dishes, and cookware so we could have cooked if we had wanted to. We mostly made use of the refrigerator as a place to keep soft drinks and wine. The room was large by New York standards and very clean. The cleaning staff went out of its way to be helpful. My partner wanted a rubber tub mat for the bathtub. The cleaning staff did not have one on hand, so one of the staff bought a rubber tub mat in Brookline where she lives and brought it to us the next morning. All the hotel staff went out of its way to be helpful. The subway stations are several blocks away, but there are city bus stops for uptown and downtown as well as crosstown travel practically at the hotel's front door, so the location is okay. We were more than pleased with the hotel and would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What's Not to Like?”
Reviews.Author: 40Acres
Reviews.Content: The other people on this site are just fussy! For the money, we thought you couldn't beat this place. They seem to be involved in a major renovation project, and some of it is a bit of a "work in progress" but the space and amenities were a great value for being IN Manhatten. We wanted to rent an apartment for a week in NYC, but that's no longer legal. Booking here, just using the hotel web page, in advance using a multi-night stay we got as good a rate as most of the apartment rentals we saw. And basically, the 1-BR suites are little apartments --- with a full kitchen, separate living room, and separate BR. Extremely clean, Everything you need. The bed looked pretty new, on the firm side but with nice padding on top so pretty comfortable. Very friendly and helpful staff. They are plainly renovating, upgrading, and they haven't gotten to everything. We weren't sure, the carpet *might* have been new, but it was an unfortunate kind of avocado green, and the slipcovered couch had seen better days. But for everything else it offered --- we could deal. One major tip: \the M50 crosstown bus is just steps from the front door (and just starting running weekends again). It's worth figuring out how to use it. If you bring a car (and try not to), there are parking garages quite close for much less than the hotel charges. We'd definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A few problems, but price was right on priceline”
Reviews.Author: Grimsbytraveller09
Reviews.Content: I wrote a review before but it has not appeared on this site. At this point now, my main complaint is that I never received a reply from management when I expressed my issues of inconvenience that we had during our 3 night stay. I emailed the hotel after our stay and did not get a response. No response shows unprofessionalism.. The hotel is fine for the priceline price. The bathroom was tiny and did not have a fan. The restaurant/lounge would not let us sit at our choice of vacant tables that were available at 10pm at night, instead they wanted to seat us in non-scenic tables. We left the lounge instead and did not return. There is an outrageous internet price of $12.00 per day although it was not specified as such when we booked. We took our computer to Starbucks and a pub instead to find places of interest to visit. Otherwise, it was ok. We probably would not stay again due to the inconvenience of no complimentary internet. Grimsby, Ontario

Reviews.Title: “Not staying here again”
Reviews.Author: DamJer
Reviews.Content: I did search through the reviews before booking this hotel and found mixed reviews. However, I gave it a chance because of the great deal we got. My great deal, quickly turned into a $1,000 stay for three nights. Not a great deal. The hotel is old and dark. I did like that the windows in the room opened. The bathrooms were less than desirable. The room was spacious, but in a weird shape with too many barriers. And most of all, we didn't intend to pay for the little critters that would come visit us over night. We woke up our last day only to find two little mice running back and forth between the rooms and the closets. I was disgusted especially since I had my 21- month old child playing in these rooms and all her stuff was on the floor. We planned to check out around 11am, but opted instead to get out of that room as quickly as possible. Believe me, if I saw the mice earlier, I never would have stayed there. Yuck! Finally, the location is great if you don't want to walk anywhere. Times Square is not within walking distance. We had to master the subway just to be able to get around because we refused to walk all the way back to the hotel. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone unless you could find it for less than $50 per night including taxes. I've stayed at many different places in NYC and it's never been this bad.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: steventaylor10520
Reviews.Content: I read some of the reviews and was a little nervous as some people make the place seem like a rundown mess, but it was actually okay. For $150 per night on Priceline, it was a great place to drop my bags and explore NYC. The hotel staff is friendly, the room was a bit dated, but very clean. The bathroom actually had a lot of character and charm. Overall no complaints. However, while we were out of the room, the maid came into the room and appeared to have smoked several cigarettes and a joint. She also appears to have had sex on our bed and left a giant love stain in the middle of it. She also took a giant dump in our toilet and left it there. Just kidding. I'm sure the manager who reads these reviews and responds to them had a momentary heart attack! While the place could use some updating, this is a perfectly acceptable option for a very affordable and pleasant overnight stay in NYC. I strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Big room, good location but don't expect too much.”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethAKissner
Reviews.Content: Pro's - Lots of space in the room which was great with 3 women, able to walk to subway stop and stuff within the city we wanted to see (about 1 mile), also had restaurants withing a few block span, bed in room was comfortable. Con's - The decor of the room is old and worn down, housekeeping never left enough towels after cleaning (only left one bath towel for 3 guests), mini fridge either froze things in it or didn't stay cold (nothing in between), pull out bed was old and very uncomfortable, had to have keys reprogrammed for unknown reason, front desk was slow to respond when called about towels or sheets for the pull out bed. Overall - The size of the hotel room would make up for the con's. We did not expect too much which made the experience okay. Don't go into the hotel expecting new or anything within the last 20 years but it's clean and a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated - but spacious, clean, friendly!”
Reviews.Author: OfficeFanMN
Reviews.Content: After looking at several lodging options - all of which were quite expensive - we rolled the dice with Priceline and were booked at the Beekman for a reasonable rate (for the area). Sure - the decor was old, the couch and carpet had seen better days, but overall we were quite content with our accommodations. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We were pleasantly surprised with an upgrade to a 1-bedroom suite (vs. the studio suite). This was a very spacious area and provided a nice separation in the event one of us wanted to sleep and the other did not. There was a separate kitchen area - which we utilized very little - but it would've been very convenient if we had chosen to buy any groceries at the nearby stores. The water pressure in the shower was great! There was plenty of closet space for hanging clothes. The A/C worked very well. Best of all - the room was clean! For me, that was much more important than the updated decor. Granted - I would expect much more from a hotel elsewhere at that rate, but since this was Manhattan, it felt like a pretty good deal. As for convenience...it was a 15-20 minute cab ride from LaGuardia (which cost around $27 with 20% tip). If you don't mind walking, you will find this location convenient. It was approximately 5-6 blocks from the subway station. Maybe about a 10-20 minute walk from the nearby attractions - such as Central Park, Rockefeller Center. We took a cab from the hotel to Greenwich Village for about $10 (including tip). Negatives: parts of the building seemed to have construction. It didn't bother us, as we were out all day. Probably the main issue for us was the bed. I assumed it would be pretty hard - and it was - but it also was not a standard Queen-size bed. I am not sure if there are different interpretations of the size of a Queen bed, but this definitely was not what we have been used to. I inquired at the front desk - and two people confirmed that it was a Queen room.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, outdated hotel, with thin, lumpy sofabeds.”
Reviews.Author: danaloy
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful, addressed our concerns appropriately and professionally. The doorman arranged a car at a very reasonable price back to JFK. Now, the negative. The refrigerator was broken in the room, sofabed run down and old, and the tile was all chipped on the floor. We awoke the first morning, with workmen on a ladder at our window. Apparently, our floor was the only one with construction. The front desk didn't know that when they gave us the room? Our room was changed, and they had all day to make up the sofabed. It was still unmade at 2100. I guess everything is expensive in NY, but for this price I expected more. As I said, the staff did try to make up for the situation. The hotel just seems outdated.

Reviews.Title: “great place , but a good walk from most major attractions , nearest attraction the rockafella about half hr walk”
Reviews.Author: SouthamptonButtercup
Reviews.Content: stayed for one week march 2011 . 4 adults . stunning rooftop resturant with fantastic panoramic views ,excellent food. we had suites which were clean and spacious. fab deli 24 hours on the corner selling hot food snacks general store, very handy. service not the best considering everyone in new york wants to help you and are so friendly . but a grat base to head back to after long days sightsing. would reccomend it as a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gvgclt
Reviews.Content: The hotel is under reconstruction and there are jack hammers on the outside of the building all day from morning until night. We had to wear earplugs to stay in the room. The hotel will not tell you about the reconstruction, and they won't refund your money. No mike sound is deafening and it never stops. There is construction dust leaking thru the windows too. The entire outside of the building is being torn off and rebuilt. STAY AWAY FROM THIS DUMP.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a family stay.”
Reviews.Author: jelhai
Reviews.Content: For our 5-day NYC vacation with children who are 11 and 13, we stayed in the Beekman's suite 17F, a very good-sized room with bedroom, full kitchen, bathroom, and separate living room that had a sofa bed. We reserved this room on the hotel's website for $224/night. It proved to be an excellent value because we prepared some meals in the room and there were several good grocery stores within a couple of blocks. The room itself was roomy, clean, and comfortable, although my wife said the decor was slightly dated (I didn't notice). When we needed additional pans and plates, the hotel's staff provided them quickly and cheerfully. We liked the relatively quiet neighborhood, which had many good dining choices. There was a minor billing mistake when we checked out that the staff resolved within minutes. Overall, an excellent experience and we'd definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Old and Tired”
Reviews.Author: Southerner057
Reviews.Content: Big rooms,old green carpeting, yellow spots on the bathroom ceiling ,cheap and scarce bath amenities, old and small towels (no bath mat) , worn out sheets (maybe 50% polyester??) old and dirty telephone, kitchen appliances that look as if they bought in the late 70s? and on top of this drilling in the wall in the morning (building under remodeling) In few words avoid this place unless you need to be next door to the UN.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with super-friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: DrSiavashi
Reviews.Content: I had booked a room at the Beekman via Priceline from 5/31/11 - 6/04/11. Later on I realized I needed to start my trip to NYC on 5/29/11, so I used Priceline again and secured a room at a different NYC hotel from 5/29 - 5/31. I had to check out of the other hotel by 11 AM on 5/31 and I showed up to the Beekman Tower Hotel at about noon, a full three hours before check-in and talked to Jan, a lovely front desk worker. She was able to accomodate my early check-in at no extra fee by UPGRADING me to a 1-bedroom suite. It was great: fully furnished living room, fully furnished bedroom, and a great little kitchen. Front-desk worker Miguel was also very helpful during my stay. Sure, the carpet may be old and the TVs are the older ones, but this overall was one of the best hotel stays I have ever had. I highly recommend the Beekman Tower Hotel to anyone needing to visit NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: JC2479
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel by bidding on priceline.. after reading the reviews.. I got a little scared considering its our anniversary. So, I called in and spoke to Lori, she was wonderful and understanding. She gave us a good room with a good view and good amenities. Overall, I was really pleasantly surprised. Liam was great too at the front desk. They say that the hotel business is about building relationships, and they got that right with their staff. Kudos Beekman Tower!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel with incredible views and wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: ILNY315
Reviews.Content: I had my wedding reception at The Top of the Tower almost 20 years ago. I had my son's Christening Luncheon there, also. We enjoyed several wedding anniversaries at The Beekman. In March 2011, I took my 14 year old son and three of his friends to Manhattan for a week. We had a two bedroom, 2 1/2 bath, kitchen, living room/dining room for an incredible rate. The staff was extremely helpful. The views of the river and city are stunning. This is a great hotel and the restaurant has excellent food!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of what is a 3 star hotel on Priceline”
Reviews.Author: sammo22
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a business trip and would never stay at this hotel. Booked this on Priceline which rated it a 3 star hotel. Thats the first problem. What does Priceline consider a 3 start hotel in New York. I have used Priceline many times and this is hotel is nowhere near a 3 star. I tried to reach Priceline only to get a recording and could never get to the right dept to put in my complaint. Now for the hotel. Our room had no bed spread and no boxspring. The carpet was torn between the bathroom and the bedroom with carpet tacks sticking out. The heat was turned off until the temp dropped to 40 degrees and then we had to get up every 1/2 hour because it kept shutting off below the requested temp. TO get it back on you had to raise the temp 2 degrees. By the end of the night the room was at 86 degrees. There was a window well outside of our window. At 7:30 A.M, there literally were 2 workers up against the window of our room doing repair! My colleague became quite ill with a dangerously high fever. We requested a late checkout. They gave us till 1:00 P.M. On my return from business I called and told them I would be running about 40 minutes late. They said not a problem but then charged me $60.00 for being 1 hour past checkout. In addition on checking in when we complained about the room and that this is not a 3 star hotel the managers answer is you get what you get! The only decent people at this hotel was the clerks behind the counter.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to rest your head.”
Reviews.Author: richnindy
Reviews.Content: When people say this hotel needs updating, trust me: that is all they mean. The kitchen and bathroom tiles and fixtures are a little worn. Nothing was broken or dirty or in disrepair. The only complaint I had was with the dirty, threadbare ironing board cover. The room was spacious, bright and clean, and the bed was very comfortable. They charge for Internet usage, but you can print your boarding pass with no charge. As everyone has said, the doormen are very friendly and helpful. All in all, it cannot be beat for $125 through Priceline. I was not crazy about the location, although the 51st & Lexington Metro station is nearby. Many nights after the theater, I simply walked down 45th, then up to the hotel. Greenacre Park nearby is lovely and peaceful, and several restaurants and drugstores are nearby. I only go on at length because some of these reviews make the Beekman Tower sound like a run-down dump. That is very, very far from the truth.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: missmaryjl
Reviews.Content: After reading the other reviews I was a bit apprehensive on what to expect. It is true, the decor is outdated but the room was comfy and clean. The location was perfect as it is walking distance to almost everything. The staff was great, everyone was very friendly and accomodating. We did have a weird situation happen with the water one night, after I took a shower my daughter went in after and when she turned the water on it came out brown, we shut the water off and waited about 5 min and then turned it back on and it was fine, I called down to the front desk and explained what happened and they apologized and said it might have been some due to some maintenance that was performed earlier that day but they hadn't gotten any other complaints. We had gone out a couple of days where it had rained and the doorman was kind enough to give an umbrella to use for our day out. The morning we left I had arranged to have a cab pick us up but the cab driver totally forgot to pick us up so the doorman was kind enough to arrange a driver for us to the airport when we stepped outside it was a white stretch limo! Would like to thank the staff for all their hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, suprising price”
Reviews.Author: IlanaYG
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near the UN, great location. The room was large, clean and shiny, a lot of windows. The stuff was nice and wherever we had a problem, they were trying to help. Though we had some kind of misunderstanding about the WI-Fi. It's not free! they charge about 20$ a day. I don't know why... Every hotel we've been to, even much cheaper than that one, we always had a free access to the internet. So you should check first with the reception desk, if it is included in your price, because we were given the code for the access but they didn't tell us that it was for 20$. When we were told to pay, we told them that we didn't know so they dropped the case, fortunately it was only for one day. The absurd is that there is a free wi-fi in the room. So why do they expect us to pay if there is a free access.... Overall, it was a very nice stay and the view from the roof (which has a nice restaurant) is stunning. You see the whole city and the river... The bus station is right beneath the hotel and the metro is at the walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday”
Reviews.Author: frascatti
Reviews.Content: Really worried when reading recent reviews before going ... needn't have ... arrived in dreadful weather, snowing, thunder/lightning and received such a warm welcome. Room was a good size but after a night's sleep bed was too small for us so after breakfast we went to reception and explained the situation, was immediately given another room with a larger bed and the room was even bigger than the first one and had a larger kitchenette (fridge/freezer was taller than me!), we were able to move immediately. All the staff were excellent and couldn't have assisted more, the knowledge and information they gave ensured we saw the sights and more. I agree the rooms are dated, the hotel was built in the 1920's and modernising would spoil it's charm, however, the standard of cleanliness was excellent, clean, crisp sheets, white fluffy towels and lovely hot showers to come back to after a cold day touring. Concierge organised a car to take us to the airport on our last day and when it arrived it was a gleaming, white stretch limo! what an end to a wonderful 40th wedding anniversary holiday. We did try the restaurant on the 26th floor but weren't impressed by the food and service, however, the view during the day and night was brilliant. Would certainly recommend this hotel to friends and family and would return for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Choose another hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sirena6
Reviews.Content: I was visiting New York for the first time. Me and my boyfriend decided to stay at the Beekman Hotel for our first night. When I got there, the hotel seemed nice and the staff was very helpful. But when we got to our room, what a disappointment! It just seemed old and dirty. The bathroom was not nice and when I took a 5 minute shower, water just flooded all over the bathroom. The bed was also very uncomfortable and it got very cold during the night.(even though we tried to adjust it). I did not get much sleep. Before we arrived I had sent them an email, but never got an answer. Poor service. Also. I brought my ipod with me. I took it out of my purse the night we got to the hotel, when we were going out to dinner. The morning after, when I was packing, I could not find my ipod anywhere. I contacted the hotel several times but never got any answers. I am extremely unhappy with my stay at the hotel and my ipod was probably stolen. The rest of my trip was spent at the Manhattan Hilton hotel, which was so much better in every apsect. And I got it for the same price. Seriously, spend your money on another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “5 star service!”
Reviews.Author: marialexx
Reviews.Content: First of all DO NOT book with priceline. They advertise â€œdeep discountsâ€� with â€˜name your own priceâ€™, but they booked me this hotel at $120/night, when the list price was $127/night. So for a 0.05 discount, you can book your own hotel, choosing exactly which hotel and where. Again, I would highly recommend not to use Priceline. On top, I found out that the rate priceline paid the hotel was $90/night (out of the $120/ night priceline charged me. So doing your own research you might get a deep discount. I indicated in priceline that we were 2 adults. And it booked me a room with one queen bed. Which I think is not acceptable unless you are a couple. I was going with my friend, and wanted thus a king bed or 2 double beds, as I assumed was standard. The hotel indicated me that they could only offer me the room priceline had booked: a room with a queen bed. AWFUL. Getting to the point, once I got to the Beekman Tower Hotel, things did turn around. It was a bit hard for me to find at first, but this was because the faÃ§ade is being renovated. This hotel is rated 3 stars, but the service is definitely 5 stars! Starting with the friendly staff at the front desk (Yvette and Miguel), to the housekeeping staff, the doorman (Aymen), and the engineering staff. I explained my situation, and at check-in, they looked for an available room to accommodate us better (fix pricelineâ€™s mess), and they did put us in a room with a queen bed but which also had a pull-out sofa bed, this without any additional charge. The staff does understand and cares about the needs of their guests. Our room was on the 14th floor, and even though the building itself is older, our room was very nice! It was very spacious, it had pretty decorations, it was clean, the furniture seemed relatively new, the bed was absolutely wonderful and comfortable, the pillows were super plush, and the sofa-bed was good. We both slept very comfortably. The shower pressure was alright, it wasnâ€™t as strong as others (like to knock you against the wall), but it was good. We had 2 big windows, and a thermostat so we could adjust the temperature we wanted. We had a kitchenette, the appliances were not modern ones, but everything worked and was clean. The staff gave us a lot of information about where to go, and all recommendations were well-founded, we had a nice time in the places they suggested. Also, since we were sleeping late, we always put our do-not-disturb sign, and every evening we found a friendly message from house-keeping saying that we could call them at our convenience to make up our room if we wanted, and also to offer clean towels.
