This is very thoughtful. We did call in for towels, and they were delivered to our room, and we could have as many as we wanted (which is great because I always need extra towels for my hair). Another shockingly pleasant experience was when we asked for sheets for the sofa-bed. Not only they sent the sheets, but sent someone to come and set the bed for us. A very friendly lady came up and made the sofa-bed very neatly and professionally! Moreover, on our second night, I locked my suitcase but left the keys inside. Thus, I had nothing to wear but the stuff I had on that morning. So that night I asked for help, and someone came to the rescue to cut my lock. The restaurant at the top of the tower has an wonderful view, especially the side looking towards the bridge (food, so-so). At check-out, all was very fast and easy. They even got me a cab. All the staff made our stay really great. I would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother - lacklustre service & unpleasent dingy room..”
Reviews.Author: daveystyles
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel to be advised the hotel was overbooked and we could be "upgraded" to the two bed suite on the the 25th floor. We were given no incentive for this forced room combination with the front desk dismissing or request for breakfast or even a free roundf of drinks in the bar.. Luckily we were two couples who were content in sharing a two bed suite.. it was late we were tired and didn't have much of a choice... I use the term "suite" loosely here it was in fact a tired , old , run down , sparcely furnished room with stained carpets - that could really do with a makeover and deep clean. On checkout the front desk attempted to chrage us more than the agreed rate stating higher taxes and the wrong rate etc.. When I advised we had paid for and settled on check-in with cash she advise th,at she would charge or credit card anyway, having discussed my point in detail she looked again and advised she had made a mistake , no apology given , customer is always right !?!? not in the beekman tower.. Hotels these days are too happy to charge now and ask later treating customers uninfomed sheep, this is very frustrating for regular travellers ..

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: Bris65
Reviews.Content: Uncomfortable bed, old, torn syntetic blankets and sheets and malfunctioning, noisy heating system. Dirty sofa. Overall a rundown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great quality!”
Reviews.Author: GailGS
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights but arrived very early before check-in. The front desk was very friendly and always held our luggage with no problems. The room was very spacious with a great kitchen and two tvs! We loved our stay here! The only thing is that the bed was a little uncomfortable but nothing we couldn't live with for two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Tired”
Reviews.Author: gecko1273
Reviews.Content: I lost my father four months ago. My husband and I decided to take my 74 year old mother to NYC to see a show for her birthday. The first birthday without her husband in 41 years. We chose the Beekman Tower based on a close friend's referral, though she had not stayed there for some time. We are very sorry that we chose this hotel. My mother's room was horrible. Outdated green carpet that was so wrinkled and stretched with age that she had to be carfeful not to trip over it. Wallpaper was peeling from the walls. To top it off, the HVAC system in her room was broken. When we asked to move her to another room we were told that the only room they could move her to was a smoking room. Our room had furniture that was falling apart, carpet that was so old it was thin in places, more peeling wallpaper, and a toilet seat that had some horrific looking stain on it. From our perspective the Beekman Tower is outdated and tired. Decor aside, the real probelm with the hotel is its unwillingness to go the extra mile for its guests. At checkout we were offered a pitiful $25 off the cost of her room. While the front desk people were very nice when they told us they couldn't do anything for us, the manager was nowhere to be found and WE were expected to call HIM to try to work things out. after the fact. Hotels are a dime a dozen in the city. Do not waste your time or money staying the Beekman Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, location and rooms”
Reviews.Author: frequenttraveller63
Reviews.Content: Hotels are extortionately expensive in Manhattan, but the Beekman Tower is pretty good value. Not only that, but the facilities are good. The room is comfortable, spacious and in good condition. Lots of windows, so lots of light, and - a rare occurrence indeed these days - windows that can actually be opened to let in the fresh air. Having a kitchenette is really useful for those of us who turn up from far-distant places, suffering from jet-lag, and want coffee at 3 in the morning - and saves on the over-priced breakfasts that are part of hotel life. A good working area - large table/desk, well lit, lots of power sockets, and fast (tho' a bit pricey) wifi. And a comfortable bed and perfectly adequate bathroom. My only grumble might be lack of closet space - but this is hardly the end of the world. Fantastic location for the UN (right across the road), and not too far from other more touristic locations. The "Top of the Tower" restaurant up on the 26th floor has a small but perfectly OK/edible menu, and the views across the Hudson River and Manhattan are a great backdrop. I'd definitely give the Beekman Tower the thumbs up, plus more, for business travellers - cheaper than most other decent hotels in the locality, and everything you want/need. Veyr charming and helful front desk staff, too.

Reviews.Title: “Coldest weekend on record beekman excelled”
Reviews.Author: iriding
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews we choose Beekman because of location and it was perfect We arrived at 8.50am expecting just to drop off our bags and they actually checked us in no problem We both had one bedroom suites type deal (though kitchenette had no use to us it was nice to have the space) The rooms are big for new york and very clean, yes they are little dated and I am sure they are a planning an update but they were GREAT. Also we were in New York for a guys weekend out if we spent more than 10 hours over a three day period at the hotel I would be amazed. There is a great deli right across the street and a diner on the opposite corner. FOR THE PRICE THIS HOTEL IS RIGHT ON THE MONEY The staff were excellent and very accomadating Would return and recomend

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay there!”
Reviews.Author: Liverdan
Reviews.Content: Good location but that is it. Upon our arrival from a long trip, we were informed that we had got an upgrade. We were pleased to hear that after many hours in a plane. When we got to our suite, what a disappointment. Old furniture missing doors, the blinds in the bathroom were all twisted, hair in the bathroom walls and floor, a piece of human nail on the floor, mold odor all over. My girlfriend refused to take a shower in the bath tub. Filthy place. When I complained to the Front Desk Manager (Veronica Maldonado), she said that she would report the problem to the Housekeeping manager and the Hotel Manager. I received an not apologetic e-mail saying that my complaints would be "investigated". I work in the hotel business and know that it was not the kind of this answer that a guest would expect to hear. I felt robbed by the price that i paid for staying in this filthy place. I've stayed in hotels all over the world. Beekman place was the worst place I ever stayed at. Do not be fooled by the pictures on their website.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good spot”
Reviews.Author: Johnsterbob
Reviews.Content: I was a bit apprehensive after reading some reviews but everything at Beekman Towers was good. Good location in Midtown NY at junction of 49th St and 1st Avenue. Beekman Tower is a 1920's art deco block with the lobby area in keeping with the style of the building. Our room on 10th floor was very clean - furniture was a bit dated but more than adequate. Staff were really helpful. We didn't eat in the rooftop restaurant but it was worth going up for the views. All Nations cafe across the road is good for breakfast. Hotel is approx 20 mins walk from Empire State, Broadway and other central sites.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value, great suite”
Reviews.Author: JD_16
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in a studio suite. We were greeted by friendly staff at reception and given a spacious room with kitchenette, large bedroom and en-suite. It was very clean with a lovely view and extremely good value for the price we paid. We ate at the restaurant on the 26th floor which had amazing views over to New Jersey. We found the service to be quite poor as we waited just under an hour to receive our starters â€“ it was quite over-priced and we felt we shouldnâ€™t have been required to pay full price considering the bad service. Other than this it was a lovely stay in a good location â€“ 10mins to nearest subway and around 20mins walk to Times Square. All in all a very good hotel in Manhattan for a reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “Other better options than the Beekman Tower.. Dont stay there!”
Reviews.Author: jeromefjeld
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a one star hotel and for the money there are lots of better options. Upon arrival, I tried to call the front desk to ask if I could change rooms. Of course, the phone did not work. I went to the front desk to let them know that the phone didnt work and that the smoke alarm was gone and to see if they had a different room because the one I was in was so dated and the carpet was so old and worn that it was gross. Well, they didn't have another room and during my three days they never fixed the phone. It's really just a run down hotel and not worth really any amount of money with all the options in NYC. Don't stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Book this room without worrying.”
Reviews.Author: nitenrz
Reviews.Content: After reading these reviews I was cautious about booking this hotel. But we needed lots of space for our family trip to NYC for thanksgiving weekend. This hotel was the best choice. It seems to be an apt complex converted to a hotel which means you will have lots of space compared to manhattan hotels. The rooms were dated. For example the tile in the bathroom seemed to be from the sixties. And the furniture seemed to be appropriate for a house and not a hotel. However the room was clean. The service was excellent. The location was great (about 5 blks from the subway). And the value unbeatable. I suggest those who need turn down service and modern furnishings--- this is not the hotel for you. But if you want to save money, have a comfortable place for 4+++ adults to sleep and don't mind a basic hotel, BOOK IT! PS. If you pay in a advance for a discounted rate, you will not be charged until you actually check in ;-)

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel staff were so nice”
Reviews.Author: happycustomer89
Reviews.Content: great hotel very clean nice quier area with lots of pubs and restaurants close by but be careful of rooftop restaurant fantastic view but drinks very expensive

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, all-round good hotel”
Reviews.Author: citybreakconnoisseur
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Beekman for 5 nights. Good midtown location - be prepared to walk a brisk 10 mins to either Grand Central or 59th and Lexington for the subway, although very easy to hail a taxi outside the hotel. The lobby area is bright and welcoming. Our room was excellent - great views, airy, manual air conditioning system, useful kitchen area, quiet at night. Staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: canEHdiancouple
Reviews.Content: This was a decent hotel. It was a good deal because we actually fit 5 adults in the room & we all split the bill so it made it very cheap. However, the room was only alright...it was clean enough, comfortable enough, but not extra service or anything special. We had to keep phoning down for basic things like sheets & pillows for the pull out couch. They seemed really understaff but the staff they did have was friendly. Our room had a small kitchen (just with a fridge, microwave, coffee maker) but it helped cut down costs because we made breakfast. There was a little corner store across the street where we could buy liquor and breakfast things (and bathroom things we forgot). I've stayed in other places in NY that were better & I don't think I would stay here again, although it wasn't a terrible experience. If you are looking for a good deal for a lot of people, this is probably good for you.

Reviews.Title: “spacious rooms are perfect for a family trip”
Reviews.Author: NMpls
Reviews.Content: We visited family in NYC in August and wanted to stay in this neighborhood because it's close to their apartment. I found a fantastic rate for a suite at the Beekman and it was the perfect place to stay with my family: big enough for everyone to fit comfortably, a separate room for me and my spouse so that we didn't have to turn out own lights out as soon as we put the kids to bed, and a kitchen so we could eat breakfast in our room. The room had a slightly worn look to it, but for the price we were paying, and the space we got, I really didn't care. The staff was friendly and accommodating, the bed was comfortable, the kids had no trouble falling asleep on the pull-out couch, and we were really happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beekman Tower Hotel disappoints”
Reviews.Author: JMGMontreal
Reviews.Content: Although the front desk were trying their best, they couldn't compensate for the poor condition of the room. The room was large but very poorly kept - dirty. The facility needs updating and upgrading, and we were happy to leave it behind us.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff helped us throughout our stay.”
Reviews.Author: pmessore
Reviews.Content: When we got to NYC with our bags around 12:30pm, we were too early to get into our room. The staff at the Beekman were eager to assist us and quickly arranged for the porter to check our bags so we could get to the matinee on time. Upon our return, it was all smiles as they asked us for our review of the show and made recommendations for dinner. We checked out our room - neat, clean but plain, exhibiting none of the fabulous art-deco style that the achitect used on the lobby and facade of the building. But - we have reasonable enough room to move about out. The next morning, we inquired about breakfast and the front desk recommended the penthouse restaurant with its 360 degree view of the city. Again, the restaurant staff were very helpful as we walked around the walkway trying to pick out the best table to enjoy the view. They were very patient with us! After a very easy check out, we were able to leave our bags again with the porter and we spent all of Sunday exploring the city. Returning to the Beekman to collect our belongings, again the front desk greeted us like old friends, hoped that we had a fun day and of course, invited us to return. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Decent Option When Midtown is Booked”
Reviews.Author: Phillytravler1
Reviews.Content: This was my second hotel during NY Fashion Week, and again, I was lucky to find a hotel in the city that was affordable. This hotel is unique because all the rooms I'm guessing, are converted apartments. This is a decent hotel, but I would say it's a 3 star property. The rooms are tired, but the largest I've ever stayed in when in NYC. The windows also opened a few inches and it was really nice to sleep with the windows open in NYC, that was a first. The neighborhood is cute and the there's a market close by to pick up anything you might need. The room service was okay. No bells or whistles here. This is a basic property and more like renting an apartment then staying in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: Sandy0919
Reviews.Content: I used to stay at this hotel 10 years ago when I would visit NYC. I recently had the oppoturnity to return. When I checked in, the "one" doorman on duty was busy and could not be found. I waited 20 minutes for him to help with my luggage and car. The furniture in the room was in need of repair. I had always loved this hotel and was so sad to see it neglected and tired. I have mixed feelings as to whether I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellen staffs but very old furniture”
Reviews.Author: sousanK
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 9 nights which is quite long time to spend in New York. The staffs over there were excellent; I think that's the only good points about this hotel. I had one bedroom suit, the bed in room was OK but sofa bed was very very uncomfortable, I hardly could sleep on that bed. Need a lot of improvements. Surprisingly, once my daughter wanted to open one of the draw she found cockroach in that draw which was very disappointing for this 3 stars hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Needs improvement in order to recommend”
Reviews.Author: gallerygoer
Reviews.Content: I have traveled extensively internationally and believe I have ample experience staying in many different types of hotels to offer this review of the Beekman Towers Hotel in New York City. I am not a particularly finicky traveler, and can tolerate many quirks and eccentricities of both new and older establishments in order to have a pleasurable experience. But the Beekman would need to make improvements before I could recommend this hotel. In fairness to the staff and management, I would like to point out the positives of the hotel first. The staff was warm, attentive, friendly ,helpful and professional. This included everyone from the front desk clerk, the bellman, the cleaning staff, the waiter at the restaurant and the limo driver. The location of the hotel is good and the view from the Top of the Tower restaurant is without question, splendid. The size of the suites are large for New York. The mattress on the bed was very comfortable. The kitchen was a plus. The negatives of the hotel, however, made for an unsatisfactory stay and I hope the management will take notes to make improvements. This hotel has all the potential to be a gem but the flaws overwhelm the potential and in my opinion, are the kinds of problems that can ruin a hotel and a reputation. The first room I refused, something that I have never done in all my years of travel. This was because the room was dingy and the carpeting was literally coming up in numerous areas. The overall look was dreadful and depressing. Having stayed in many hotels in NYC, I was stunned at what was offered compared to the photo on the website. The front desk receptionist kindly changed my room but there were still issues with the upgrade . I could not disrupt my schedule to look for other accommodations, so I stayed the duration of three nights. Some of the issues could be overlooked--like the scratchy towels, the lack of supplies considered the norm , the runs and frays and stains of the carpeting, the multiple (and large) scratches and stains on the furniture , the aged and yellowing wallpaper, the bargain basement shower curtain, and the absence of the scheduled 5:30 a.m. wake-up call for a flight that needed to be caught. Those problems, many cosmetic in nature, were not to the standard one would expect of similarly- priced hotels in NYC, but could have been tolerated. What was found to be unacceptable, by any standard, was the mildew on the shower tiles, the dusty and broken mini-blind in the bathroom, the mildew and stain on the shower curtain, and the thick layer of dust on the floor between the tub and the vanity. For these, there is no acceptable excuse. Additionally, the pull-out sleeper sofa was un-usable and cigarette smoke wafted in from a neighboring room and filled the living room with sickening air at night. Travelers need to be forewarned about these problems because some are health concerns. Basic cleanliness is imperative in the hospitality industry and I am hoping that management will address these concerns so that other travelers will not experience similar problems and disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, Flexible Management”
Reviews.Author: Sam_in_seattle_87
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a week ago, for 4 days, and had a good experience. The hotel is undergoing construction on the 2nd floor, and after waking up to construction and requesting a transfer, hotel management transferred us to a larger room, away from construction, within a few minutes at no extra charge. The service was good, and hotel room was clean. Full kitchen, plus plates, cutlery, and cups are provided. The hotel room was surprisingly spacious for NYC. My only objections are there is no bathroom fan and the shower curtains need to be replaced. But, these are minor and the Beekman Tower Hotel is a great place to stay, at an affordable rate. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value!”
Reviews.Author: cdrop0011
Reviews.Content: We visited NYC July 21st - July 26th. We booked a 1 br deluxe. Our room was located in a seperate entrance. Once we got to the room we were surprised at how large it was. However, the room was very HOT!!!! The air conditioner in the living room area was not working. We contacted the front desk who immediatly moved us to a different room after maintenance was unable to repair it. The new room we moved to was even larger!!! I noticed that the hotel does need some updating. The sofa was dirty, sofabed was extremely hard to pull out, carpet was old, not enough dishes in the kitchen, old televisions and more. The room was not dirty however room service did miss a few spots in cleaning. This did not bother me and my family. I pulled out my Lysol and went to work. I do this in 4 and 5 star hotels too! I have a large family and it is hard to find accomadations in Times Square. We went to NYC on vacation which is what we done. We were hardly ever in the room. We were close to the subway stations, bus stop directly in front of building, and corner market across the street. Overall, I will stay at Beekman Tower's again which will most likely be next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, No Frills, Great Location, Blast from the 1970s”
Reviews.Author: paulrevere1773
Reviews.Content: The good: Location is convenient for anyone, particularly a tourist. Close to the bus and subway lines, and a good launching point for exploring Midtown by foot. Location is safe and just a few blocks from the river and UN. Cost was very affordable using travelocity. Rooms are suites and gigantic. They were built from old apartments. My room had 1.5 baths, a kitchen, a large living room, and a bedroom. The bad: Rooms are very outdated and in disrepair. Bed was surprisingly comfortable. TV was ancient. Bathroom was gross. Carpet must have been from the Nixon era. Housekeeping service was poor. Front desk customer service was poor and minimal. The lobby was tiny. The restaurant menu was very expensive, especially considering the hotel wasn't all that fancy. If I would have done it again, I would have stayed at a Club Quarters or the new World Center Hotel in the financial district.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Esther072
Reviews.Content: Had a very relaxing stay, very nice and helpful staff. Will defnitely visit again. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our vacation”
Reviews.Author: eeeema
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my teenage daughter and her friend from June 23 to June 26, 2010. The hotel was perfect for us. It had a separate bedroom which the girls shared, and I used the queen sized pull out couch. The kitchenette had everything we needed. The room was clean and air conditioning was excellent, which was so important that week as it was unseasonably hot. We stayed in the part that has the separate entrance and liked that there were only two rooms per floor. The double door entrance made us feel secure since you needed your room key to enter both doors. The front desk staff was very professional, friendly and helpful. We also received excellent advice from the day time doorman about Ess-a-Bagel, our favorite bagel place â€“ we went there every morning. We were able to check our bags the last morning so that, after check out, we could continue our shopping until later in the afternoon. The doorman was also very helpful flagging a cab for us the few times we required it. The location is great â€“a 5 to 10 minute walk to the subway, and the tradeoff of a quiet neighborhood is worth it. Overall we loved this hotel, would recommend it, and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Place, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: cheeks027
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel from July 2nd-July 6th. Check-in was easy and we found our hotel room to be more than what we expected. I'll admit that I was a little freaked out to stay here when I read poor reviews about this hotel before I visited NYC. I found our room to be clean, large, and very comfortable. Sure, the place could use some updating, but there wasn't anything in the room that was hard on the eyes. We used the fridge a lot since we always picked up a few waters across the street before staying in for the night. There was a large mirrored sliding door closet that held our clothes, and another closet close to the bathroom. The bathroom and shower area were fine, and there was even a window in the shower that could be opened up. The view was amazing from our bed and it seemed cozy to come home to after a long day walking the pavement. The only thing I would have liked was for the AC to be a little bit quieter. It was nice and cool in our room, just noisy. The hotel is in Midtown East, which I loved because it was a lot quieter than the hustle and bustle of Times Square. We had no problem catching a cab from this area because there was no one to fight for it. It is pretty much as east as you want to get, but we walked 10 minutes to the subway (we used that a lot), and we managed to walk to Times Square, Grand Central, and the MoMa from our hotel. Maybe we're used to walking quite a bit, b/c it didn't bother us at the time but we were tired at the end of the day. We went up to the top of the hotel restaurant to see the view when we first got there and that was really nice. We also checked out the work out room, which was better than I expected. They even had a his and hers sauna, but we didn't use it since NYC was having a heat wave. Our hotel was cleaned well everyday and we didn't experience anyone knocking on our door early to clean it, like some people had mentioned on this site. We went to Pressbox for beer and appetizers and to watch the World Cup. Nice place and within easy walking distance of Beekman. We also ate at Ess-A-Bagel one morning, along with Moonstruck, which had amazing french toast. We went to Mother's for $2 beer and $3 margaritas after seeing an off-broadway comedy, and wanted to stop in at Mint, a well-reviewed Indian restaurant near our hotel but ran out of time. Front desk even called a nice taxi car for us ($39 including tolls and tips for the driver) to La Guardia when we were ready to fly back home. I got a $105/ per night price from Priceline and I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal on a very nice room...”
Reviews.Author: chiavatore
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night and were able to get a one room studio room for less than $100. We were pleasantly surprised by the size of the room and the view of the 59th street bridge. The midtown location was convenient to many shops, restaurants and tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Dated, dirty and depressing”
Reviews.Author: hereandthere25
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with our room at the Beekman Tower Hotel. When we checked in they told us they "upgraded " us to a room in the annex. The top of the refrigerator in the kitchenette had not been cleaned in a while which led me to take a closer look around. The hide-a- bed sofa was stained and torn, nothing I wanted to sit on. There was a baggie, and worse, a dirty q-tip behind the dresser. Mold in the bathtub which they have tried to cover up with caulking. We called the desk to complain and polite young man who came to check out our complaints said "We do apologize." We asked to change rooms but they were full up and had nothing else. They sent someone to clean up. Granted, we were staying there on points, but that shouldn't have mattered. On the positive side, the air conditioning worked.

Reviews.Title: “Its old, a bit tired but great service from the staff.”
Reviews.Author: Stokee7
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Beekman and after reading some of the reviews here we wondered just how much it had changed since our last visit. We stayed fro seven nights from June 10th - June 17th. It is old and maybe the rooms are in need of some tender loving care, but we could not fault the cleaniness of the room or the kitchen, and whats more there were no bed bugs!. Our suite consisted of a lounge, kitchen, bedroom and bathroom, it was enormous compared with some rooms in New York. One complaint I had was the lack of equipment in the kitchen. I did not try asking for anymore as there was a deli across the road which sold hot food every evening. Another anoyance was the maid knocking on the door every morning at 9.30am wanting to clean. The staff at the Beekman were unbelievably helpful and always had a smile and a greeting whatever time of the day it was. If you are looking for a cheap hotel slightly away from the noise etc. I recommend the Beekman. Dont expect 4 star luxury but dont forget you are not paying for that either.!

Reviews.Title: “Brunch”
Reviews.Author: travaillour
Reviews.Content: group of 50 had bruch at the top of the tower. The view was breath taking. The service was buffet style. The selection was fair. The eggs were scrambled before hand. The selection of fruit could have been selected with more care for presentation and freshness. ex. the bananas were green, the grapes did not appear washed, the other fruit was bruised. The servers were polite but not well organized. This is a very old structure so has to be appreciated for it's old charm. It is in excellent walking distance to the UN.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Jason1436
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel we have ever stayed in while in NY (4th trip). The suite is an actual 2 room suite and is huge by normal standards, let alone small NY room standards. Our family had plenty of room (2 adults, teenager, 6 and 2 yr old). The kitchenette was a great bonus (full size fridge, microwave, stove, sink and dishwasher). My only complaint was poor service from the front desk. Made two afterhours calls for service (a/c stopped working and need for extra towels). Both requests went unanswered and had to call back. The rooms are in need of updating.....old carpet, furniture, etc. It didnt bother me, but I could see how it would bother others. There is a grocery store and diner across the street and a pharmacy two blocks up. Its a bit of a walk to the subway station (2 blocks over and 3 up). Doesnt sound like much, but it gets old after 4 days. Essa Bagel is on the way, so it was worth it. You have to go to Essa Bagel if you're in the area (51st @ 1st). They have the best bagels in town!!

Reviews.Title: “Treated me like family, loved my "apartment"”
Reviews.Author: jena16
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in, I was given a beautiful "apartment" in their East Tower. I could have hosted a party for 20+ people easily -- all hardwood floors, separate bedroom with french doors and a walk-in closet, full kitchen, beautiful views. Everyone was so nice and friendly -- free wireless and reasonable room service to boot! Very happy there!!

Reviews.Title: “Staff Are Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: Emily067
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked in for three nights (Fri, Sat & Sun) via Priceline. When we arrived at the hotel (around 9pm) we were greeted by a very friendly staff at reception. We got info on parking (right around the block - Was a total of $90 for three full days plus...) and checked into our room. We went up to the room to discover we were placed in a room with two twin beds. We immediately called down to reception (very easy to find button on phone and worked the first time we tried - Unlike another poster's comments) and explained that we were there for our anniversary and when we booked with Priceline, I specifically requested a double bed). The woman on reception checked our reservation and confirmed that Priceline had agreed to put us up in a Twin room (despite our specifications) and told me she'd check the system and call us back asap. Within 3 minutes she called back and explained that all of their basic rooms were full and they would only be able to provide us with an upgrade room for $169 per night. Since we had only paid $110 on Priceline, we passed on this and thanked her for looking into this for us. We then went to move our car into the parking garage and when we returned we were greeted by the reception staff and the hotel manager who agreed to upgrade us for free. Our room was very spacious and appeared to be clean. We were only on the 8th floor but the view was still pretty good - Looking over backyards of the condos, not directly into buildings across from us. We had no trouble with water pooling on the floor despite the two shower curtains...We moved them down to the middle/end of the shower and it was fine - No problems with room. Location wasn't bad - It was much more quiet and safe feeling than it would have been in other "convenient" areas of town. We bought the $8.25 Metro card each day which was good for unlimited travel on subways/buses for a 24-hour period. There is a bus stop at the front of the hotel which you could use. We chose to walk to the subway station at 51st and Lexington, about a 5-10 minute walk. This was only one stop away from Grand Central and also ran downtown right to Battery Park. It was very convenient and we found that going back to a quieter area of town after a hectic day out was just what we needed. The doorman greeted us every time we entered/left the building and knew who we were. This made us feel very safe as he was very aware who was going in and out at all times. In all, we got a great deal on this hotel, and we would have paid more for it. We are completely satisfied with our stay at the Beekman. Your experiences are always what you make them - Choose to nit pick and be negative, and you will find nothing will please you. Choose to remember that you are on vacation, be laid back and positive, and you will attract positive situations.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - for a suite with old furnitures”
Reviews.Author: Joseph1616
Reviews.Content: Overall happy with this hotel, clean, people are very nice, good service. Room and furnitures are very old, old bed, has a plywood under the mattress. Old carpet. We had a cuisinnette, lots of space and the price that we paid was reasonable. We had a great price on priceline for a suite.

Reviews.Title: “1STAR HOTEL IN 5 STAR NEIGHBORHOOD”
Reviews.Author: skippie19
Reviews.Content: Don't bother asking for early check in, because early check in means, checking in later than the other guests. Rooms are not ready, and housekeeping does not communicate with front desk staff. Room first had no towels and we had to basically beg to have towels brought up so we could shower after waiting over 5 hours for our room to be ready. Towels and sheets are stained and torn and still used on for service. There is no one obvisiously doing room inspections, for cleanlieness and supplies. Besides torn to shred towels and ripped sheets, the carpets were not vacuumed, I had dropped dirt purposely and it was never cleaned up in a week, and previous guest items were found in the corners and under the beds. The one star if for the size of the rooms, which are effiencienes and they are large, but since we had no heat during the day nor a/c, we had to turn on the gas oven to heat the room on cold days and open the windows on hot days. The maid would leave the windows open on cold days after cleaning,and the room would be an ice box when we returned. It seemed that few cared about guest services, the remote control didn't work, and it was hard getting elevators at times. Calling the desk and housekeeping was hard, since the numbers on the phone were incorrect, and the only correct numbers were on the key card case they gave you upon checkin. It is a shame that such a great location, cold tolerate such poor service. The only response I got from management was a emailed letter saying how sorry they were for my experience, and hoped I would come back again. I said I would not, and they never responded again. Obviously they really don't care and don't need the tourist business, since they get a lot of the guests from the UN. I was recommneded this hotel by a friends whose corporation used this facility and I hope they move their business to another establishment.

Reviews.Title: “The Beekman merits a 3.5 rating - with a good room assignment at a reasonable rate, though, round up to a 4”
Reviews.Author: DonInConnecticut
Reviews.Content: There are a few scary Beekman reviews on this site mixed in with predominantly good ones. Give 'em a careful read; my conclusion is that the Beekman has mostly solid rooms but also a small inventory of "bad news" ones (probably on very low floors and/or the annex that one unhappy guest wrote of). Perhaps these lemons are reserved for lowball stays (Priceline, and perhaps Hotwire) and/or nights when the hotel is genuinely 100% capacity. Since I'd booked a multi-night stay via Priceline, this made me nervous. My solution was to speak very cheerfully with the desk clerk about my desire for an upper floor. (I threw in the request for "a view if at at all possible, but I understand that may not be possible). A $20 tip might have been involved, too. Viola. By that time, the clerk had pulled up my reservation - and I'd seen a printed card with a low-floor room number. Ugh. Happily, that was changed to something in the low teens to mid-20s, where I figured most everything would be good. And it was. First, this review is adjusted for "NYC on a budget" standards. So we begin with dialing down the expectations. In Denver or Cleveland or Pittsbugh, I'd expect a whole lot more amenities and modernness - with a lower rate - before assigning a 4-star value. But in Manhattan, the deal is: Either spend many hundreds a night or expect claustrophobic rooms, "venerable" decor, hallway and street noise, surly staff, and either a tiny gym or none at all, The smallest, blandest pool is an insane luxury, and whirlpools and saunas rarely exist even at the 5-star-deluxe platinum card level. So by those measurements, the Beekman isn't bad. The location near the U.N. is too far east to be really convenient for getting around the city by subway or on foot, but it's safe and reasonably tranquil. (Expect the convenience factor to improve if the city every builds the long-planned 2nd Avenue subway). The art deco building is attractive, the lobby is nothing dramatic but pleasant enough. You're in a neighborhood surrounded by consulates and upscale condos and apartments, and there's an overall feeling that you're too far off the beaten path to attract the drunken suburban teens, panhandlers, sketchy grifters and others who crowd Midtown on weekend nights. (By comparison, the scene just outside the Marriott Marquis at 1 a.m. on a Saturday can be a bit crazed. There are plenty of cops, but also armies of inebriated out-of-towners and doubly inebriated foreign tourists wandering through crowds of sour-looking young locals "hanging out." ) The 26th floor restaurant is worth a visit for a drink or a soda - take the opportunity to visit the narrow outdoor veranda/balcony if the weather permits. The East River views are terrific. My room was substantially larger than what you usually get in Manhattan. A bit dated, but nothing bad at all. A double closet next to a breakfast alcove/work space; a kitchenette with microwave, fridge/freezer and oven; a large bedroom with a second closet; and a small but updated bathroom with tub and shower. The windows open a few inches; great if you like a breeze. 1st Avenue is busy enough that you'll hear traffic, but it's not a round-the-clock cacaphony of honking taxis & screeching tires like so many Midtown streets are. $12.95 for Internet access. No dedicated work area (use the small, round kitchen table). An unflashy but reasonably good gym with a few treadmills, weights and a couple of exercise cycles. A safe, ironing board and iron, crazy amounts of bureau and closet storage space. Small TV at an awkward angle to the bed, but I never watch the stupid thing anyway - the nice touch here is that you can just close cabinet doors on that bureau, and the TV is out of view for the rest of your stay. Comfortable bed, old but not objectionable carpet, fairly pleasant front desk and cheerful bellman. Even at Priceline rates, this was north of $120 a night. To me, that's way more than I pay in average markets (God, Priceline has spoiled me. A modern 4-star in Boston or Montreal "should" run about $80 a night on my scale). But NYC isn't an average market, and this hotel is a very pleasant bargain. Expect the Waldorf and you'll be disappointed. But count on a one-of-a-kind old-style Manhattan hotel with a little flair here and maybe a couple of worn edges there, and you'll find some good value at the Beekman.

Reviews.Title: “Five Ds:Disgraceful, Dirty, Depressing, Dreary, Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: calinurse
Reviews.Content: It's a disgrace that some company is making money on this hotel. Obviously, the owners do not care about guests except as a way to pay off their monetary investment. While it may be "budget" for NYC--at nearly $200/night--this hotel is a shabby excuse for even "low-cost" accommodations. We arrived in the morning via "red-eye"plane, having paid for the room starting the night before .The hotel staff knew we'd arrive in the morning after booking and paying for the previous night. Perhaps this meant we were allotted the worst room in the hotel (because people who arrived earlier got better rooms--first come, first served). Perhaps it was because we booked via Hotwire ($143--no bargain as it turned out) . It was room 3G. Our window view onto First Ave was of scaffolding, dirty cigarette butts swimming in puddles on the ledge, and that sharp spikey wire that is used to keep birds from alighting. We should have taken it as a warning to keep humans away as well. The lobby is dark, gloomy and dreary. Surely you can keep that Retro, genuine 1920s wood panel and beautiful antique clock, with some spiffing up or a coat of light -color paint? This was faded and gloomy, without a hint of charm. One doorman /assistant Henry was helpful , cheerful, and pleasant (quite a challenge in that atmosphere). He greeted a housekeeper , who responded with a scowl. Another doorman was asked by the receptionist to call a cab. The cab never came, and we couldn't even ask if it had been called, as he quickly disappeared from his post in the entry hall. The queen-siae bed was surprisingly comfortable--unless we were so tired after a sleepless night on the plane that we didnt notice. it was a 5 or 6 inch height mattress--the kind that are rarely seen any more (in keeping with the antique look?) . NO bedbugs. The mattress pad was old and tattered. Towels and blanket had small holes in them, but were clean. Check out time is noon. At 9 am we were awoken by pounding on the door. "When are you leaving?!!" Perhaps the housekeeper was shocked that anyone would want to stay past the early morning hours. Room cleanliness: kitchenette and bathroom clean to the naked eye. Disillusionment set in once in bed, staring up at a large, black cobweb on the ceiling--the kind that has been attracting soot for some time. As we checked for things we might have left under the bed, we found someone else's things left behind--some trash which had been missed. Room size: minute. NYC is known for small rooms, but this was beyond the norm. There was a small kitchenette but no table or chairs. The only place to eat would have been on the bed. Minimal utensils, but there was a corkscrew-- perfect for the needs of guests ready to hit the wine bottle at the idea of an overnight in Room 3G! Furniture: French provincial style, circa 1960. The mattress and pad dated from that era too, I assume. Bathroom: cute and typical NYC apt size. it would be nice if the owners could spring for one bathtub-size curtain, instead of two separate stall shower curtains which left g a big gap in the middle, No liner curtain, so shower water made a pond on the floor queen size bed barely fit. there was a kitvhenette, but othig to eat on. We went from this hotel to one three blocks away that cost about $35 more per night and was about 30 times better. The front desk staff seem to really care about the guests. There is one young lady who works in the afternoons/evenings and she is delightful. Natasha, in the morning, is calm and professional and attentive. They are rays of brightness in this grey gloomy place. Please , if you are in NYC for pleasure, choose another hotel. I love New York, and I'd hate for anyone to have to come back after a wonderful day out, to a room like we had. Even two days was two too many.

Reviews.Title: “Can fault it”
Reviews.Author: reshpatel
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fine, no probs at all. We stayed at the Beekman Tower for two weeks. Staff are very helpful especially Migal from reception. Nothing was too much trouble for him. 20 min walk to Times Square which wasnâ€™t too bad, took a different route each time. Nice way of seeing NY. Room had is own kitchen, which came in handy, as we had the comfort of cooking our own food when we liked, also the facility of having a nice cold drink in the evenings. Hotel even has cheap self laundry facility, not seen this in any NY hotel before. This is my 4th visit to NY and this has to be the best hotel I have stayed in, value for money, big room, delightful staff. Its not 5* so donâ€™t expect that, its comfortable, what more do you want in a city like NY, its not about the hotel, and most people are only in the city for a few nights, Beekman Tower is perfect. Hotel has a nice restaurant on the top floor, great views of NY. Nice cocktails, shame they didnâ€™t have many vegetarian options. Waiter was not very accommodating, I was informed when making the reservation, kitchen would be able to make me a veg meal, no such thing, waiter did not even offer anything of the sort, infact felt I was ignore the whole evening, was not asked if I wanted main course as there was no vegetarian dish on the menu and he knew I couldnâ€™t have anything, what was worse was he didnâ€™t even ask if I wanted a second drink, however he came over to my husband 4 times to ask him if he wanted a drink! Not pleased with the service in the restaurant. The only downside was the maid would ask us if we would like our room serviced, if we answered yes, we felt like she was swearing at us, we barley go a smile from her! We felt we had to avoid her each morning, run from the room straight into he lift!! She was quite good, except she left us small towels, no bath towels like the ones we had the day we arrived. The replacement maid while the regular one was on leave was no good at all, had one towel between the 2 of us, no hand or face towel either! Anyway these are just small problems, not enough to complain about. There is a good supermarket on 48th and 2nd, fresh food and all grocery, including Heinz Baked Beans. Even though we had a few problems I would still strongly recommend you to book this hotel, staff are always at hand. We are not big complainers, so we didnâ€™t let I ruin our break.

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: elula63
Reviews.Content: my husband and I and a couple of friends stayed in this nice hotel for three nights and really enjoyed the spacious two-rooms and kitchenette that we got.It was very comfortable and clean/The staff at the reception was very helpful and friendly/Right below the hotel there is a small shop that is open 24-hs and has almost "everything"/We had to walk 15-20 minutes to Times Square but enjoyed every minute of this (We had wonderful weather)/ Ariella

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, good location and great price!”
Reviews.Author: rowers090
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on priceline and were a little bit worried after reading some of the reviews. If you get this hotel for a decent price you will be very happy especially if you need room for kids etc. We went with 2 teenagers and were quite happy with the hotel. The location is good and is close to a grocery store and some decent restaurants. its not a very far walk to any major attractiion. We walked to times square, madison square garden and lots of other attractions. The rooms are a fair size and include a fridge, stove and full kitchen. The only thing i didn't like about the room is the bathroom is in the master bedroom so the kids have to come into the bedroom all the time. It was a minor nuisince though and overall we were very happy. The staff are very nice and helpful. There is a excercise room on the second floor along with internet. The computers cost $5 for ten minutes i think.

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfortable rooms and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: MyCentsWorth
Reviews.Content: :) The Good We named our own price (priceline) before looking at reviews on tripadvisor and I was prepared for the worst after reading a few. We had a very nice room on the 9th floor with small kitchen stocked with pots, pans, dishes, etc. and the housekeepers that came every day even washed our dishes:) The furniture and wallpaper was a bit worn but clean. The bathroom also had signs of wear (this place has been around awhile) but was clean and stocked with towels, hair dryer, several soaps, lotions, shampoos, body wash and even :( The Bad The $12.95 a day for internet was a real big stinker, and you had to pay to use the business center too. We used our phones for email, maps, etc and saved the $12.95 for coffee, cookies and treats.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised, Helpful staff, clean rooms, great value for dollar”
Reviews.Author: alexmatos1979
Reviews.Content: Before our trip, I read some of the very negative reviews on this site, specifically a review by someone from Toronto (my hometown) and this freaked me out! Issues re:bedbug infestation, rats dancing around like its Mardi Gras, and rooms that were in dungeons. I was so freaked out that I decided to deal with these issues headon and call the hotel management to inquire as to how they have dealt with the issues. They assured me they had dealt with them. I am pleased to say that my wife and I are professionals at inspecting for bedbugs - NONE FOUND and not a single mouse/rat or even dropping was found. The room was impeccable (sorry if misspelled). The apparent dungeon room (i.e. 4D) was a great room in front of the elevator. The restaurant had an awesome view! The staff was SUPER helpful, especially Luis (I think that was his name, the Puertorrican guy at the front). The only negatives are: the distance to the subway and even that one wasn't so bad; Hotel at 1st/49th and the closest station was 51st street station on the 6 line; The bathtub was a little older and the bathroom as colder, the carpets were a little older, nothing out of this world. Totally recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “You should consider this hotel if there are four of you and you don't want to pay for two rooms”
Reviews.Author: Billysouthwales
Reviews.Content: I had extremely cheap flights and we stayed here (Me, Wife, Sister and Hubby) for a budget break. We were looking at hotels and, for something reasonable, the prices were just silly. Anyway, we got this for the cost of two rooms in a hotel with shared facilities, and it turned out to be a gem! Location - near the UN Headquarters, it's about 25 minutes walk to Times Square. Grand Central, etc is about 20 minutes walk, so not miles away. Rooms - We had a one bedroom apartment. Bedroom, Bathroom, Living / Dining area and Kitchenette if you wanted to cook food yourself. There was a sofa bed in the living room. Rooms were more spacious than the Park Central (the other hotel I have stayed in New York) and nice and clean. Hotel - There are elevators in the hotel, so no problems with access, and a rooftop bar / diner. We went to the bar a few times, the view is magnificent although this building is small by new your standards. Prices were reasonable, but you are paying a premium for the view. Surrounding area - Across the road there are a couple of Deli's (good for coffee, juice and donuts in the morning) There are some excellent bars within a five minute walk to 2nd Ave (For example, The Manchester, The Press Box, etc). Slightly cheaper than those around Times Square, and really welcoming. We had good food in the Press Box. Summary - I have stayed near Times Square and Here and there are advantages to both. Staying here I saw more of New York because we walked quite a lot. Plan your route and walk a different way each time. Most Enjoyable

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel, Good location”
Reviews.Author: KEH40
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean, spacious and comfortable. The location of this hotel if you are willing to walk is great. Only 15 mins walk to Rockefeller centre and Times Square, and its in a quiet location with a fantastic view over the river. The restaurant at the top is well recommended. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, room not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: tinitsa
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel from Priceline, so I didn't choose it. The website made it look great. When I checked in, I was put in a room, that to get to it, I had to go back outside, down the street a ways, to a separate entrance, where only 2 rooms were located down a hallway. The view (from a hotel called "Towers") was a brick wall on 2 sides. The room was spacious, though needed to be upgraded. The furniture was very old. The mattress, when I sat on it, came up on both ends (I am not a large person). The maid service left a lot to be desired, there was hair (not mine) in the corners of the floor in the bathroom, and on the bedsheets. There were missing tiles on the floor and mildew on the tiles in the shower. The service, including the bellmen and the people taking my reservation, tried to be very helpful. I couldn't help but think being placed in the tower may have been better, but there were no rooms available there. I will not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beekman infested with bedbugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: coolcatToronto
Reviews.Content: If you don't want to come home with bed bug souvenirs, then avoid the Beekman like the plague. We travelled with our 6 year old for 3 days. She was in a roll away bed. The room looked shabby with limp, curtains, peeling wallpaper and mold in the shower. I wouldn't have minded if not for the fact that during the second night I was eaten alive by bedbugs. Didn't know why I was itchy the next day until I saw raised bumps on my arms and thought it was a skin irritation. In the morning I had killed a 1cm bug on the wall going under a picture frame on the wall. I thought it might be a cockroach, but was surprised to see how much blood came out of it. I later discovered that it was my blood! I then noticed billboards all over New York stating that bed bugs were rampant in the hotels. Here it is 3 days after our return and I have counted about 100 bites! They had been feasting on me! My daughter on the roll away bed was thankfully only bitten in two places and my husband on 3 places. I had the misfortune to be on the wrong side of the bed. So...even though New York was fantastic, I would never ever go back to the Beekman after suffering the itchiness and raised welts all over my body.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near most attractions”
Reviews.Author: holidaytimeLondon
Reviews.Content: Some of the reviews for the Beekman were a bit scary , but when we arrived we were very pleased. The Beekman Tower Hotel offers huge suite's including lounge with TV, Dining area , kitchen , and bedroom with en-suite, yes the furniture is a bit dated , but the apartment was clean with all our needs , the only problem was the double bed - it dipped in the middle . The Beekman Tower is close to everything, Grand Central , Times Square ( about 20 mins walk ) 5th Avenue etc. We go the subway to Ground Zero and the got on the free ferry to Staten Island passing The Statue of Liberty on the way. Central Park is lovely , we paid $34 Dollars for a half hour horse and trap ride around the park ( like you see in the films ) Well worth it ... Had a fantastic time in New York - loved it - would love to go back in the Summer. Bye the way ,dont be scared... felt very safe here , there are police everywhere and on the subways, the city is also very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: LuisaN3
Reviews.Content: This hotel was once an apartment building that has been converted into a hotel. We had a corner apt on the 19th floor. We felt like tru new yorkers! And, theres a restaurant on the 26th floor with terraces as well. It was just an awesome experience! Im definitely staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: hooeyBoston
Reviews.Content: I haven't stayed at the Beekman for awhile, but decided to give it a try again because it had such a reasonable rate. The staff were so helpful and polite, along with the maids and doormen also. Nice quiet side of town. I was wondering why the adjoining restaurant had closed, which was a nice plus. We did take advantage of the complimentary breakfast at the Top of the Tower which was fabulous overlooking the East River. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: SharMoll
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Oct 09 for 4 nights. We were given a junior suite which included fridge,cooker and microwave. The room was lovely, decor just fine. The location was excellent, only 8 mins on foot to Rockafella center. Small restaurant and cornor shop directly across the street for all you may need. The restaurant on the top floor has beautiful views, we ate there one night, food prices similar to home prices, drinks were little pricey. Discovered since it is owned by Anglo Irish bank, but is run better than the bank so no worries there...

Reviews.Title: “Sliding Downhill Rapidly”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Beekman quite a few times over the past five or six years. We were happy to trade the location and room size for the shabby decor and tired carpets. However, the last two times this year has convinced us to give up on the place. We were told that the hotel does not provide room heating unless the outdoor temperature is under 50 F (sounds like tenement rules to me). The doormen were never at the door and if they ever appeared, it was outside smoking. Our in-room tea alowance was one teabag and three packets of sugar daily. The trash bins were not emptied daily and the rest of housekeeping service was prefunctory. A guest left their room service tray and dishes next to the elevator door and IT STAYED THERE FOR TWO DAYS!!

Reviews.Title: “Tired but spacious”
Reviews.Author: aapjebaapje
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked this hotel through Thomas Cook. We wanted a twin room with a kitchen and the Beekman Tower provided just that. However, I should mention that although we "requested" a twin room, it was just that - a request and it wasn't until my friend phoned the hotel direct as soon as we'd made the reservation that they ensured that we had a twin room. They only have three twin suites according to the receptionist so if you have a specific request it's worth phoning and confirming. When we got there the receptionist had our twin booking and our original booking - which turned out to be a queen suite. He cancelled this and left us with the twin booking without any fuss. Our room wasn't ready at 3pm but they stowed our luggage and we went for a quick walk and the room was ready at 3.30pm. The suite (3L) was large and until the air conditioning was switched on, right at the end of our holiday, it was very quiet. The aircon/heating in the room works very well indeed. It was the aircon outside the lounge window that was an issue. However, we got used to it pretty quickly and we weren't in the room very much. The bedroom is at the front of the hotel which was very quiet. As other guests have mentioned, the furniture and carpet are very tired but I'm rather glad that this was the case since it meant that the space was affordable. Had it been more newly furnished it may have been out of our price bracket as it's location was excellent. This part of town is very quiet but still close to the Empire State Building (easily walkable) etc. Our room was perfectly clean.

Reviews.Title: “Poor old Beekman”
Reviews.Author: CH&WW
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Beekman many times over the years and have always overlooked its air of shabbiness because we liked the size of the rooms and the genteel feel of the hotel; it's always reminded us of a big but unfancy New York apartment. But our three-night stay in room 11D has persuaded us to give up on the tired old Beekman after all these years. We've never seen hotel furniture in such bad condition, scratched and scraped and looking as if it was found in a thrift shop. (That's no exaggeration.) The Beekman's carpet has always been a little threadbare, but in this room it was ripped and stained and at least 10 years past replacement. The bathroom blinds were bent and twisted as if someone had tried to rip them down. And the bathroom itself was frightening -- a moldy shower curtain, a toilet seat that was the wrong shape for the toilet, and grunge everywhere we looked. While the front desk folks were fine, the housekeeping was hit and miss. (Why clean someplace that will still look dirty when you're done?) All this for nearly $300 a night. It's a shame. The Beekman is a wonderful building in a good location, but until the owner, the Luxe Group, invests in critically needed renovations we won't be going back. It's a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, tired and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: LimehouseTraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel cost $300 per night and I would have expected more for that price. I can see that it has a certain Art Deco charm but my room looked as though it hadn't been decorated since the early part of the 20th century. Dark and dingy room, old and shabby furniture, sticky carpets, cracked tiles, cobwebs. On the plus side it was a large room (more like a mini-apartment really with separate double bedroom, small kitchen and a living room with dining room table, sofa (with pull out bed) and TV. Bizarrely the so-called 'fully equipped' kitchen had a full-size gas cooker with oven and grill but no pots and pans or any other cooking utensils. There was , however, a fridge and a microwave so I managed to microwave mugs of water to make tea! A toaster and coffee machine were also supplied. For a hotel marketed at business visitors I was surprised that there was no in-room internet access. There was a business center on the second floor where you had to pay 30 cents a minute to use the internet. There was a fairly well-equiped gym and an over-priced restaurant on the 26th Floor (maybe worth it for a drink to admire the views but make sure you eat elsewhere).

Reviews.Title: “Good, low cost option in Midtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: quietneil
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated on the intersection of 51 St. and 1st Av. in Midtown Manhattan. Although this is not quite in the centre of Manhattan it is placed relatively close to some of the main attractions New York has to offer including; the UN headquarters, grand central station, empire state building and 5th Av. These attractions are around a 20 minute walk away. The nearest subway station (number 6 on the green line) is a 10 minute walk away meaning that it is often quicker to walk than to take the subway. For those willing to do some walking whilst in New York this is hotel offers a good compromise between cost and location. For those slightly older and unable to walk too far this is probably not the best hotel for you. In terms of the room, ours was very clean and relatively large for the price. We paid around Â£90 ($150) a night and we had our own kitchen with breakfast stalls, sofa, queen-sized bed and en-suite bathroom. Although the decor is slightly outdated nothing was damaged or broken. The staff were friendly and helpful. They even gave us free Wifi for the duration of our stay, although it is usually $10 per night. The internet was very fast and reliable. All in all, for a 3 star hotel, this hotel offers good value for money. Apart from the proximity to the subway there is very little to grumble about. If you're on a budget and wish to save a significant sum of money when compared to hotels very close to 5th Av and Times Square then this may be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MississippiTravels
Reviews.Content: This was our second year to visit New York and also our second time to stay at the Beekman Tower. The location is great. Just down the street from the UN and only a short distance from the Theater District. The transit authority has a bus stop just across the street from the front door. The staff was wonderful. Rooms were always clean. One note..this is not a new hotel and don't expect that.

Reviews.Title: “Huige suites, but somewhat outdated”
Reviews.Author: h0rsewithn0name
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers huge suites, nice staff and fairly clean rooms. The hotel is somewhat old and the good things come at a price.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Suites - good location and very quiet”
Reviews.Author: MichiganTravelor00
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a on one bedroom queen standard suite. Our room was on the 22nd floor and had a great view. The room was clean and spacious. It had a fully equipped kitchen, living area with table and pull-out sofa, and nice master bedroom/comfortable bed. The bathroom had beautiful marble tile. This was a good location, clean , and quiet - walking distance to Grand Central Terminal. The only recommendation on the pull-out sofa ( and this is true with most pull-out sofas ) - this sleeps one person and would bring a egg crate topper/foam mattress for comfort. Also, bring an air mattress/extra bedding for other teen age children.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, great value and convenience!”
Reviews.Author: ChiefJen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Beekman one weekend. The staff are friendly and helpful. The other guests we met were also friendly. Some had returned to this hotel many times, we learned. The room was roomy, and the kitchenette had everything we needed to cook a nice brunch. There was a grocery right across the street. Yes, some of the furniture and rugs could be updated, but this was a trivial matter.

Reviews.Title: “Most enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: offalyguy25
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my brother the last couple of days of july first week of august had the most enjoyable time, we got a suite on the 4th floor, with out own kitchen , equipped with fridge, coffeemaker, microwave, oven, cooker, dishwasher, we wanted for nothing, each day our cleaners would leave us heaps of coffee, and tea etc, we left a dollar each for them every morning on the table in living room, we stayed a week and had no problems at all, only thing i found bad was cost of internet, if u have your own laptop you have to pay a charge for room every night, but if you go to conference room it is 10 dollars for half an hour, fitness room is well enough equipped for a basic workout, and the staff are friendly, they sent us back to airport in a stretch limo haha. but if you want a good stay in a nice decently priced hotel then stay here, 24 hr shop across the road that has everything you need, and a greek restaurant beside that with cheap tasty food, i will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Unsafe. Do not stay here.”
Reviews.Author: jr4444
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a safety risk and is seedy. After checking in, I noticed the hotel door locks were broken, screws were stripped. Needless to say, we did not feel safe -- we did not stay the night. Unless you feel like sitting by the door all night waiting for intruders, do not stay here. Mascara and strange-looking hairs covered the bed. The management did not offer us a refund, instead literally blaming us for not contacting the hotel engineer at 9pm to fix whatever issues there were. How it is our fault that the hotel was not safe is beyond me. We stayed elsewhere, and had to eat the cost of booking at the Beekman. I am an easy-to-please traveler, and this is the first time that I have even written a review, because I think that other travelers should absolutely find somewhere else to stay in NYC when visiting. You may get lucky and have an enjoyable stay, but you may also have a stay like ours, with safety issues and unhelpful management.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Good Location for your Money”
Reviews.Author: 2wetravel2gether
Reviews.Content: Just came back From New York City Manhattan with my husband and 2 kids 11 and 12. We stay at the Beekman Hotel in a Queen Suite. The rooms were very spacious, Kitchen with 4 eye burner, microwave, fridge and dishwasher. Included in the room is a dining room table, pull out couch, TV, A/C in the living and separate Bedroom. The hotel help was great, polite and answered out questions. I talked to one employee thatâ€™s been working at the same hotel fro 20yrs and loves it. They have a restaurant at the top floor and a fitness centre on the 2nd floor. Location is on 1st Ave about 6 blocks from Broadway itâ€™s a good walk, we did a few times but also used the subway or taxis. I would suggest the hop on hop off tour bus, it educational and we could get off at any location were the tour bus stopped and get back on (buses run every 10-15 min). The Tour bus stops 5 min walk from the hotel. New York is very expensive, anything on Broadway is very costly, if you want to eat, got past 9th Ave, it gets less expensive. I would stay at this hotel for the convenience of having a kitchen in our room and the price and service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Beekman your hayday is over.”
Reviews.Author: warholstyle
Reviews.Content: $724 for 3 nights in NYC and the hotel has a mouse! This hotel was rated a 3 star. I booked for 3 people, and got a room with one small double bed and a pullout couch. The pullout couch was in such bad condition that you could not sleep with it pulled out. The couch folded up was not much better. After I booked i saw reviews online about this hotel which stated that the hotel was dirty and there a few comments about mice. I called up hotwire right away and the hotwire associate was unbelievably out of line. I told him about the reviews, letting him know that perhaps the condition of the hotel was not the same as it was when hotwire first partnered with the hotel or gave it its star rating. When I mentioned the mouse he told me "Look I have watched 20/20 and I know all about how everywhere has mice." How can it be acceptable to have a 3 star hotel with mice. This hotel would probably have been great 30-40 years ago in its art deco glory. But there has clearly not been any renovations or upgrades in at least 15 years. I cannot fault the hotel, since with any quick search of the hotel your know what you are getting your self into, the reviews don't lie. I can only fault hotwire.They claim that you will have a hotel with a specific rating, and that it will be comparable to reputable named hotels. This did not live up to the hotwire description. Booking with hotwire leaves you helpless. You have NO power at the hotel to complain about the conditions since you have already paid. This hot is old, do not expect frills. The carpets are weathered and worn, the couches are uncomfortable, the beds are hard. This hotel is also loud. First room was 2H this faces 1st AVE, loud street noise. Then we were switched to 5AII, this room had less street noise but the toilet would run constantly. I would say if you are looking to book a hotel do not book here, I am sure you can find something better. the trip in from Jersey would be well worth it! But if you were like me and booked through Hotwire and did not choose this hotel, but are stuck with it, I saw just be prepared. I made my self sick after reading reviews, hoping they were not true, but fearing they probably were. My tips would be: Do NOT bring ANY food into the room so the mice won't stick around. Keep your luggage zipped up even if its on a table, the mouse in our room was on teh table! Bring ear plugs. Ask to switch rooms, some will be better than others. The restaurant is nice, and they give out free breakfast vouchers to solve all problems so take advantage of that. Good luck and sorry if anyone else gets roped into this hotel by hotwire. I will say that the Beekman staff overall were nice, and really this hotel is just bad so if you book there it is what it is so to some degree i Do not fault the beekman staff. The star rating should for sure be downgraded though.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Passionduvoyage
Reviews.Content: The price of the hotel is quite OK for New York. The room is a mini suite wit kitchen, living room, bedroom and bathroom. We had an issue with the toilets but they fixed it quickly. They have a private parking, which is good for NY but it does cost 42$ per day. Very close from the ONU and quite close from 5th avenue and Central Park (if you do not mind walking a bit). To go to Statue of Liberty better take the subway tho.

Reviews.Title: “Great midtown east location”
Reviews.Author: cckone
Reviews.Content: Transportation (bus) on the corner, taxis usually out front. Small lobby and front desk with friendly staff. Three elevator banks for quick service. Top floor bar and restaurant open for breakfast and dinner - great all around view! Guest laundry coin operated in basement; fitness and business center on 2nd floor accessible with electronic room key (card) only. Wireless internet in rooms for $9.95 per day. Kitchenette with adequate plates, silverware and glasses ; coffee maker and microwave. Triple sheeted beds a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “good experience”
Reviews.Author: carlotta2
Reviews.Content: Clean room, good location, great kitchen area with refrigerator no noise problem. Felt we had a great value in safe area close to everything. Nice staff. No complaints

Reviews.Title: “Tired and depressing. Beekman owners: sort it out!”
Reviews.Author: chillywinter
Reviews.Content: We last stayed in the Beekman two years ago. It was a bit run-down in places, but the room was good and clean and we had a fuss-free stay. We were very pleased to be returning, and were excited when we arrived. That feeling quickly evaporated. The room we were given was really shabby and tired. It's possible it hadn't been occupied in a while, and it hadn't been vacuumed properly. Worst of all, while in the kitchenette, I noticed that there were mouse droppings. I couldn't work out what I was more annoyed by - that there were mice in the first place, or the fact that they hadn't bothered to hide the fact by cleaning up the mess! Unfortunately, the hotel was full that night and we couldn't be moved. To the credit of the desk staff, they offered us gratis drinks in the bar at the top of the hotel and moved us the following day, to a room three floors below. The new room was clean and tidy - no mice droppings - but also looked like it had seen better days. The communal areas (apart from the brand new business centre) all needed a lick of paint and new carpets. In the past I've recommended this hotel, but I won't in future. This could be a great hotel: it's in a good location and it has very caring staff (especially desk staff and doormen), but at the moment it's totally letting itself down. I urge you, Affinia Hotels, spend some money on this place and sort it out.

Reviews.Title: “very good value for money and great location”
Reviews.Author: foxy_london_lady
Reviews.Content: We have been in this hotel for a week in May09. This was our second trip to NYC. Last year we stayed in New Jersey and transfer was a nightmare, so this location made a huge difference. It takes about 10-15 min to walk to Rockefeller Centre, if you take a bus at 49th St., you will get to Times Sq. in a couple of minutes. First night we got an upgrade to apartment which had kitchen, bedroom, living room and a bathroom. The rest of the week we had standard room which we originally booked and the only difference was that the bedroom was combined with living room area, but it still had sofa and separate kitchen with breakfast table. For some reason I found the standard room much nicer than the apartment, not sure if it was refurbished, because the furniture was a little used but I felt comfortable in this room. The room was clean, the only problem was the bed, it was quite narrow for me and my partner. Otherwise the room is very good value for money, because it is apartmentlike with very good location and also cheaper then most of the hotels in this area. Also a must is a bar/restaurant on the top of the hotel, very nice view. I can recomend a very good japanese restaurant YAMA on East 49th Street, they make the best pork dish we have ever had (I forgot the name but i think it was the only one in the menu). Also there is a diner called Nations Cafe right across the street from the hotel where they make really good pancakes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ankit_Saxena
Reviews.Content: I was there for a conference in the UN. This was a minute's walk away from the UN building. It has amazing rooms. They're massive. you have a living room, a kitchen, a bedroom and an ironing room. Its a whole apartment. 15 minutes walk to the times square. The view from the top of the tower is amazing. There is a nice cafe in front of the hotel which satisfies all your cuisine desires. I proffered picking up some stuff from the Gourmet store across the road and cooking myself. Its highly recommended if you're traveling with your kids or with your family. The television has a great set of movies. You can get here from JFK at exactly 45 dollars in the Yellow cabs, fixed rate. Do not get into the cabs which are not the yellow ones. They charge you double the price. These drivers come upto you the moment you leave the airport and offer you taxis. The hotel provided me with a limousine for my departure to JFK for a mere 60 dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Mattress I Ever (Tried to) Sleep On”
Reviews.Author: Lookingforagoodhotel
Reviews.Content: This is supposed to be a 3 1/2 star hotel, but the bed in my room would have embarrassed a zero star hotel. Also, the overnight temperature in New York City on the night of my stay was in the high 30's, even though this was in May, and there was no heat in the room. I spent an uncomfortable night.

Reviews.Title: “unbeatable value for money”
Reviews.Author: mabemawi
